title: Brownies (Love and Lemons)
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2/3 cup cocoa powder (sifted), 1/2 cup powdered sugar (sifted), 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips, 3/4 tsp sea salt, 2 large eggs, 1/2 cup canola oil or extra-virgin olive oil, 2 tbsp water, 1/2 tsp vanilla
directions: Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Spray an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray and line with parchment paper. Combine dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Whisk eggs, oil, water, and vanilla in a large bowl. Add dry mix to wet mix and stir until combined. Pour batter into the pan and smooth the top. Bake for 40-48 minutes. Cool completely before slicing.
notes_on_texture: Thick and fudgy, slightly underbaked texture preferred.
equipment_needed: 8x8 baking dish, cooking spray, parchment paper, mixing bowls, spatula
cleaned_texture: Thick and fudgy slightly underbaked texture preferred

title: Cocoa Brownies (Inspired Taste)
ingredients: 10 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup + 2 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 tsp fine sea salt, 2 large cold eggs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2/3 cup walnuts, pecans, or chocolate chips (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8-inch square baking pan with parchment paper. Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in sugar, cocoa, vanilla, and salt. Let cool, then add eggs. Stir in flour, then nuts or chocolate chips. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Cool completely before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy and moist in the center, slightly underbaked for a rich texture.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, parchment paper, saucepan, mixing bowl, spatula
cleaned_texture: Fudgy and moist in the center slightly underbaked for a rich texture

title: Best Brownies (AllRecipes)
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp baking powder, 3 tbsp butter (for frosting), 3 tbsp cocoa powder (for frosting), 1 tbsp honey (for frosting), 1 tsp vanilla (for frosting), 1 cup confectioners' sugar (for frosting)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan. Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Frost Brownies with butter, cocoa, honey, vanilla, and sugar mix while warm.
notes_on_texture: Rich and fudgy, with a warm, smooth frosting.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, saucepan, mixing bowl, spatula
cleaned_texture: Rich and fudgy with a warm smooth frosting

title: The Best Cocoa Fudge Brownies (Baker by Nature)
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp espresso powder (optional), 3/4 cup unsalted butter, 2 tbsp oil, 1 1/3 cups granulated sugar, 2 large eggs, 1 egg yolk, 3/4 cup chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line a 9x9 pan with parchment. Sift flour, baking powder, salt, cocoa, espresso. Heat butter, oil, and sugar, add to eggs and mix. Add dry ingredients and chocolate chips. Bake 30 minutes. Cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy, with firm edges and a shiny, cracked top.
equipment_needed: 9x9 pan, parchment paper, saucepan, mixing bowls, spatula
cleaned_texture: Fudgy with firm edges and a shiny cracked top

title: Chewy Brownies (Handle the Heat)
ingredients: 5 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 2 large eggs + 1 egg yolk (cold), 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 3/4 cup cocoa powder, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1/8 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 3/4 cup semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Microwave butter and sugar. Whisk eggs and vanilla. Stir in oil, cocoa powder, flour, cornstarch, and chocolate chips. Bake 30 minutes. Cool completely.
notes_on_texture: Gooey when warm, chewy at room temperature, and fudgy when chilled.
equipment_needed: 8x8 pan, microwave-safe bowl, spatula, foil or parchment paper, nonstick spray
cleaned_texture: Gooey when warm chewy at room temperature and fudgy when chilled

title: Brownies (Preppy Kitchen)
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, 2 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 3 large eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease and line an 8x8-inch pan with parchment paper. Melt butter in the microwave, then whisk in sugar and cocoa. Add eggs, vanilla, and salt, mix well. Fold in flour and chocolate chips. Spread batter in pan and bake for 35-40 minutes. Let cool completely before slicing.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy or cakey depending on doneness, moist crumbs for fudgy, fewer crumbs for cakey.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, microwave-safe bowl, spatula, mixing bowls, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Fudgy or cakey depending on doneness moist crumbs for fudgy fewer crumbs for cakey

title: Fudgy Brownies (Baran Bakery)
ingredients: 3/4 cup salted butter, 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup light brown sugar, 1/2 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder, 3 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp fine sea salt, pinch of sea salt flakes for topping
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF convection (or 325¬¨‚àûF conventional). Grease and line an 8x8 pan. Microwave butter and chocolate until melted. In a large bowl, whisk together sugars, cocoa, vanilla, and eggs until smooth. Add melted chocolate mixture, whisk until combined. Add flour and salt, whisk until just combined. Spread batter into pan and bake for 40-45 minutes. Cool for 30-60 minutes, top with sea salt flakes.
notes_on_texture: Thin, crackly top with a fudgy center.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, heatproof bowl, mixing bowls, whisk, spatula, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Thin crackly top with a fudgy center

title: One-Bowl Brownies (Two Peas and Their Pod)
ingredients: 1 cup butter (melted), 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup dark brown sugar (packed), 4 large eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup Dutch-processed or unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp espresso powder (optional), 1 tsp kosher salt, 1 1/4 cups chopped chocolate
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Spray a 9x13 pan with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together melted butter, sugars, eggs, and vanilla. Sift in flour and cocoa, add salt and espresso powder. Stir until just combined. Fold in 1 cup chopped chocolate. Spread batter into pan, sprinkle remaining chocolate on top. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Let cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Chewy with a crispy edge and set texture as it cools.
equipment_needed: 9x13 baking pan, parchment paper, mixing bowl, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Chewy with a crispy edge and set texture as it cools

title: Best Brownies (Once Upon a Chef)
ingredients: 2 sticks unsalted butter, 8 oz bittersweet or semisweet chocolate, 4 large eggs, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup dark brown sugar (packed), 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup all-purpose flour
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line a 13x9 pan with parchment paper and grease with butter or nonstick spray. Melt butter and chocolate in microwave, whisk until smooth. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, salt, sugars, and vanilla. Add chocolate-butter mixture, whisk until smooth, then whisk in flour. Pour into prepared pan, bake for 45 minutes. Cool completely before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Shiny crust with a firm but moist interior, perfect for freezing.
equipment_needed: 13x9-inch pan, parchment paper, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: Shiny crust with a firm but moist interior perfect for freezing

title: Easy Chocolate Brownies (RecipeTin Eats)
ingredients: 1 3/4 sticks unsalted butter, 1 1/4 cups dark chocolate chips, 1 cup brown sugar (loosely packed), 3 eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup plain flour, 1/4 cup cocoa powder, pinch of salt, 6 oz dark chocolate bar (optional), 1.5 cups walnuts (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Spray an 8-inch square pan with oil and line with parchment paper. Melt butter and chocolate chips in microwave, stir until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla, mix well, then add eggs and stir until smooth. Add flour, cocoa, and salt, mix until smooth. Stir in chopped chocolate, pour into pan. Bake for 24-32 minutes, depending on desired texture. Rest 10 minutes before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Gooey, fudgy, or cake-like depending on bake time.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, spatula, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Gooey fudgy or cakelike depending on bake time

title: Seriously Fudgy Homemade Brownies (Sally's Baking Addiction)
ingredients: 3/4 cup unsalted butter, 4 oz semi-sweet chocolate bar (divided), 2 cups granulated sugar, 3 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup cocoa powder, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp salt, 1 1/4 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease or line a 9x13 pan. Melt butter and half the chopped chocolate in microwave. Whisk in sugar, then eggs and vanilla. Add cocoa powder, flour, salt, remaining chocolate, and chocolate chips. Fold everything together. Spread batter in pan and bake for 30-32 minutes, until a toothpick comes out with moist crumbs. Cool completely before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Super fudgy with moist crumbs when baked to perfection.
equipment_needed: 9x13 pan, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, spatula, parchment or foil
cleaned_texture: Super fudgy with moist crumbs when baked to perfection

title: Dark Chocolate Brownies (The Pioneer Woman)
ingredients: 1 cup butter, 5 oz unsweetened chocolate, 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1 tbsp vanilla, 3 large eggs, 1 1/4 cups flour, 3/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips, powdered sugar for sifting
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Melt butter and unsweetened chocolate in a saucepan, whisk in cocoa powder. Remove from heat, cool for 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and vanilla, then eggs one at a time. Stir in flour until halfway combined, then fold in chocolate chips. Spread batter in a greased 8x8 or 9x13 pan. Bake for 40-50 minutes. Cool completely before cutting and sprinkling with powdered sugar.
notes_on_texture: Thick and rich Brownies, best served after cooling for several hours or the next day.
equipment_needed: 8x8 or 9x13 baking pan, saucepan, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Thick and rich Brownies best served after cooling for several hours or the next day

title: Chewy Brownies (The Kitchen Magpie)
ingredients: 3/4 cup salted butter, 1 1/2 cups white sugar, 3/4 cup cocoa powder, 3 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, 2/3 cup chocolate chips (optional), 3/4 cup all-purpose flour
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line a 9x9 pan with parchment paper. Melt butter in a medium pot over medium heat, remove from heat and stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in cocoa powder, then beat in eggs and vanilla. Add chocolate chips (optional), then stir in flour just until combined. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until Brownies pull away from edges. Cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Chewy and fudgy with optional chocolate chips for extra richness.
equipment_needed: 9x9 pan, medium pot, parchment paper, spatula
cleaned_texture: Chewy and fudgy with optional chocolate chips for extra richness

title: Chocolate Frosted Brownies (Tastes Better from Scratch)
ingredients: 1 cup oil, 2 cups granulated sugar, 4 large eggs, 6 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp salt, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, Optional Frosting: 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, pinch of salt, 2-3 cups powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 5-6 tbsp milk
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Mix sugar and oil in a bowl, then add eggs one at a time, followed by vanilla. Stir in cocoa powder, salt, and flour. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan and bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely before frosting. For frosting, cream butter, cocoa powder, and salt, then add vanilla, powdered sugar, and milk until desired consistency. Frost Brownies and store in an airtight container.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy Brownies with optional creamy chocolate frosting.
equipment_needed: 9x13 pan, mixing bowls, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Fudgy Brownies with optional creamy chocolate frosting

title: Fudgy Brownies (Natasha's Kitchen)
ingredients: 1/2 lb unsalted butter, 16 oz semisweet chocolate chips (divided), 4 large eggs, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 1 tbsp instant coffee granules, 3 tbsp light olive oil, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 2/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Butter and line a 9x9 pan with parchment paper. Melt 2 cups chocolate chips with butter in a saucepan over low heat, then set aside to cool. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, coffee granules, oil, and vanilla. Stir in cooled chocolate mixture. In another bowl, whisk flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt, then fold into batter until just combined. Transfer to pan, sprinkle remaining chocolate chips, and bake for 35-40 minutes. Cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Super fudgy Brownies with a rich chocolate flavor, best served at room temperature.
equipment_needed: 9x9 pan, saucepan, whisk, spatula, mixing bowls, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Super fudgy Brownies with a rich chocolate flavor best served at room temperature

title: Fudgy Brownies (Natasha's Kitchen)
ingredients: 1/2 lb unsalted butter, 16 oz semisweet chocolate chips (divided), 4 large eggs, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 1 tbsp instant coffee granules, 3 tbsp light olive oil, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 2/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Butter a 9x9 pan and line with parchment paper. Melt 2 cups of chocolate chips with butter, set aside to cool. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, coffee granules, oil, and vanilla. Stir in cooled chocolate mixture. Fold in flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Pour batter into pan, sprinkle remaining chocolate chips on top, and bake for 35-40 minutes. Cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Super fudgy Brownies with a rich chocolate flavor, best when cooled before serving.
equipment_needed: 9x9 pan, parchment paper, saucepan, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Super fudgy Brownies with a rich chocolate flavor best when cooled before serving

title: Quick and Easy Brownies (AllRecipes)
ingredients: 2 cups white sugar, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup melted butter, 4 eggs, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 cup walnut halves
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease a 9x13-inch pan. In a large bowl, mix together sugar, flour, melted butter, eggs, cocoa powder, vanilla, baking powder, and salt. Spread batter into the prepared pan. Decorate with walnut halves. Bake for 20-30 minutes, until the top is dry and edges pull away from the sides. Cool before slicing.
notes_on_texture: Quick and easy Brownies with a chewy, nutty texture.
equipment_needed: 9x13 pan, mixing bowl, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Quick and easy Brownies with a chewy nutty texture

title: Easy One-Bowl Fudgy Cocoa Brownies (Gimme Delicious)
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter or oil, 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup add-ins (chocolate chips, nuts, etc.)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease an 8x8 or 9x5 pan. Melt butter in a microwave-safe bowl, then whisk in sugar and cocoa powder for 1 minute until sugar dissolves. Add eggs one at a time, then vanilla, whisking until the batter is shiny. Stir in flour and salt until fully combined, careful not to overmix. Fold in add-ins if using. Spread batter into the pan and bake for 20 minutes or until center is slightly set. Cool completely before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy with a shiny top, easy one-bowl preparation.
equipment_needed: 8x8 or 9x5 pan, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Fudgy with a shiny top easy onebowl preparation

title: Easy Homemade Brownies (My TX Kitchen)
ingredients: 1/2 cup melted butter, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1 1/2 cups chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line a 9x9 square pan with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk together butter, sugar, and vanilla. Whisk in eggs until incorporated. Add baking soda, salt, flour, and cocoa powder, stirring until combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool for 30 minutes before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Thick and rich Brownies with a chewy texture, chocolate chips add extra fudginess.
equipment_needed: 9x9 metal pan, parchment paper, whisk, mixing bowl
cleaned_texture: Thick and rich Brownies with a chewy texture chocolate chips add extra fudginess

title: Best Easy Brownies (Handle the Heat)
ingredients: 10 tbsp unsalted butter, 4 oz semisweet chocolate (chopped), 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs + 1 egg yolk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 tsp fine salt, 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8-inch square pan with parchment paper. Microwave chocolate and butter in 30-second intervals until melted. Stir in sugar, then cool slightly. Whisk in eggs, egg yolk, and vanilla. Stir in flour, cocoa powder, and salt until just combined, then fold in chocolate chips. Pour into pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. Let cool for 30 minutes before slicing.
notes_on_texture: Shiny crust on top, fudgy with moist crumbs in the center.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, parchment paper, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Shiny crust on top fudgy with moist crumbs in the center

title: Easy Homemade Brownies (I Heart Naptime)
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (melted), 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup light brown sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8x8 pan with parchment paper and spray with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, whisk together melted butter, vegetable oil, granulated sugar, and brown sugar. Add eggs and vanilla and whisk for 1 minute. Stir in flour, cocoa powder, and salt until just combined. Add chocolate chips and stir. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool slightly in the pan before cutting into squares.
notes_on_texture: Rich and chewy with optional chocolate chips for extra fudginess.
equipment_needed: 8x8 pan, parchment paper, whisk, mixing bowl, spatula
cleaned_texture: Rich and chewy with optional chocolate chips for extra fudginess

title: Super Easy Homemade Brownies (The Baking Chocolatess)
ingredients: 2/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 2 tbsp canola oil, 1 1/4 cups sugar, 2 eggs or 1/2 cup applesauce, 1 tbsp vanilla extract
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease or line an 8x8 square pan with parchment paper. Mix flour, cocoa, and salt, and set aside. Melt butter in the microwave, then whisk in oil and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, and mix until well combined. Stir in the flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Spoon batter into the prepared pan and bake for 28-30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out with a few crumbs. Cool before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Rich and thick Brownies with a soft center and crispy edges.
equipment_needed: 8x8 pan, microwave-safe bowl, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Rich and thick Brownies with a soft center and crispy edges

title: Quick and Easy Brownies Like Box Mix (Life, Love and Sugar)
ingredients: 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 tsp + 1/8 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp salt, 3/4 cup vegetable oil, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 3 large eggs
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease a 9x9 square pan or line it with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, mix flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. In a large bowl, mix oil, sugar, and vanilla. Add eggs and stir until well combined. Mix in dry ingredients without overmixing. Pour batter into pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool before removing from the pan and slicing into bars.
notes_on_texture: Moist and fudgy with a texture like a box mix.
equipment_needed: 9x9 pan, parchment paper, mixing bowls, whisk
cleaned_texture: Moist and fudgy with a texture like a box mix

title: Brownies (The Kitchn)
ingredients: 2 sticks unsalted butter, 6 oz bittersweet chocolate, 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 3 large eggs, 1 large egg yolk, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp instant espresso powder (optional), 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup cocoa powder, 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Grease a 9x13-inch pan and line with parchment. Melt butter and chocolate in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in sugar and let cool for 5-10 minutes. Whisk in eggs, yolk, vanilla, espresso powder (optional), and salt. Sift in flour and cocoa powder, and fold until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool before cutting into squares.
notes_on_texture: Smooth and glossy batter with rich chocolate flavor and fudgy texture.
equipment_needed: 9x13-inch pan, parchment paper, saucepan, whisk, spatula
cleaned_texture: Smooth and glossy batter with rich chocolate flavor and fudgy texture

title: Best Brownies (Simply Recipes)
ingredients: 10 tbsp unsalted butter, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup + 2 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 tsp almond extract, 2 cold large eggs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2/3 cup pecan pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8-inch square pan with parchment paper. Heat butter, cocoa, sugar, and salt in a large metal bowl set over a skillet with simmering water. Stir until smooth and hot to touch. Remove from heat. Stir in almond extract. Beat in eggs one at a time, then mix in flour and beat batter until smooth. Stir in pecans. Pour batter into pan and smooth. Bake for 25-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out moist but not raw. Cool completely before cutting into squares.
notes_on_texture: Smooth, shiny, and thick batter resulting in fudgy, nutty Brownies.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, parchment paper, metal bowl, skillet, whisk
cleaned_texture: Smooth shiny and thick batter resulting in fudgy nutty Brownies

title: Easy Brownies (NYT Cooking)
ingredients: 3 oz unsweetened chocolate, 8 tbsp butter, 1 cup sugar, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, Pinch of salt, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. In a small saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate and butter, stirring occasionally. When melted, transfer to a bowl and stir in sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add flour, salt (if using unsalted butter), and vanilla (optional), stirring just until no flour remains. Pour into greased 8-inch square pan. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until set and firm in the center. Cool before cutting into squares.
notes_on_texture: Set and firm in the center, with a rich chocolate flavor.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square pan, saucepan, mixing bowl, whisk
cleaned_texture: Set and firm in the center with a rich chocolate flavor

title: Fudgy Brownies (Cakes By MK)
ingredients: 3/4 cup dark chocolate, 3/4 cup flour, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2/3 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp coffee powder, 1 tsp vanilla essence, 1 cup white sugar, 2 large eggs
directions: Preheat oven to 320¬¨‚àûF with fan on. Grease an 8-inch square tin and line with parchment. Cut chocolate into chunks and mix with flour and salt. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine butter, oil, cocoa powder, brown sugar, coffee, and vanilla. Heat in 20-second bursts, mixing until liquid and hot. Set aside. In another bowl, beat white sugar and eggs until light and creamy (3 minutes). Fold chocolate mixture into egg mixture, then gently fold in dry ingredients. Pour batter into tin and bake for 22-25 minutes. Let cool for 1 hour before cutting.
notes_on_texture: Rich, fudgy Brownies with a dense, gooey texture.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square tin, mixing bowls, microwave, hand mixer
cleaned_texture: Rich fudgy Brownies with a dense gooey texture

title: Fudgy Brownies I (AllRecipes)
ingredients: 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 2/3 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup boiling water, 2 cups white sugar, 2 large eggs, 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 tsp salt
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan. Stir cocoa and baking soda together in a large bowl. Mix in boiling water and 1/3 cup oil until well blended and thickened. Stir in sugar, remaining oil, and eggs. Mix in flour, vanilla, and salt until just absorbed. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool before cutting into 24 squares.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy Brownies with a rich, dense texture.
equipment_needed: 9x13-inch pan, mixing bowl, spatula, measuring cups
cleaned_texture: Fudgy Brownies with a rich dense texture

title: Best Fudgy Cocoa Brownies (Cafe Delites)
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1 tbsp cooking oil, 1 1/8 cup sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 tsp salt
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease an 8-inch square pan and line with parchment paper. Combine hot melted butter, oil, and sugar in a bowl. Whisk well for 1 minute. Add eggs and vanilla; beat until lighter in color. Sift in flour, cocoa powder, and salt. Fold until just combined. Pour batter into pan and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the center no longer jiggles. Let cool before slicing into 16 Brownies.
notes_on_texture: Fudgy, rich Brownies with a dense, gooey center.
equipment_needed: 8-inch square baking pan, mixing bowl, whisk, spatula, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Fudgy rich Brownies with a dense gooey center

title: Cakey Brownies
ingredients: 6 ounces dark chocolate chips (170 grams), 6 tablespoons unsalted butter (85 grams), 1 cup granulated sugar (200 grams), 2 large eggs (100 grams), 2 tablespoons brewed black coffee (28 grams), 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract (8 grams), ¬¨√¶ cup all-purpose flour (90 grams), ¬¨¬∫ cup unsweetened cocoa powder (21 grams), ¬¨Œ© teaspoon baking powder (2 grams), ¬¨Œ© teaspoon kosher salt, ¬¨Œ© cup chocolate chips (85 grams, optional), ¬¨Œ© cup chopped nuts (57 grams, optional)
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8‚àö√≥8-inch baking pan with parchment paper. Set aside.
2. Place the butter and chocolate chips in a heatproof glass bowl and microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between each blast of heat, until smooth. Add the sugar and whisk well. Set aside to cool for about 5 minutes.
3. Add the eggs to the cooled chocolate mixture and whisk well until the batter thickens.
4. Add the coffee and vanilla and mix until combined, about 1-2 minutes.
5. Whisk in the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
6. Fold in nuts or chocolate chips, if using.
7. Transfer the batter to the prepared baking pan.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes until top is dry, then remove to cool completely.
notes_on_texture: Cakey
equipment_needed: Kitchen Scale (optional), 8‚àö√≥8 Baking Pan
cleaned_texture: Cakey

title: The Best Brownies
ingredients: ¬¨√¶ cup butter (6 oz), 1 ‚Äö√ñ√Æ cup sugar (350 grams) - divided, 3 large eggs, ‚Äö√ñ√Æ cup cocoa powder (65 grams), 1 cup all-purpose flour (120 grams), ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, 1 cup chocolate chips (170 grams) plus more for the top
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease and line an 8‚àö√≥8 square pan with parchment paper. Set aside.
2. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine butter and ‚Äö√ñ√Æ cup sugar until butter is melted. Set aside to cool.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk eggs with the remaining 1 cup sugar until the mix begins to foam.
4. Gradually whisk the butter mixture into the egg mixture. Ensure butter isn‚Äö√Ñ√¥t piping hot.
5. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, and salt over the batter. Mix until fully incorporated.
6. Fold in chocolate chips and pour into the prepared pan. Top with additional chocolate chips.

cleaned_texture: Set with a few cracks on top

title: Cake Brownies
ingredients: 1 ¬¨Œ© cups granulated sugar (250 g), ¬¨√¶ cup unsalted butter, ¬¨Œ© cup cocoa powder, 1 ¬¨Œ© cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, ¬¨Œ© tsp baking soda, ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup milk, 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

1. Preheat the oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease and line a 9‚àö√≥13 pan with spray oil and parchment paper. Set aside.

5. Gradually add the flour mixture and milk in portions, stirring to combine.

title: Cakey Brownies (Bake from Scratch)

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Spray an 8-inch square pan with cooking spray. Line with parchment paper.

title: Deep Dish Brownies

1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan.

title: Fudgy Cakey Family-Size Decadent Brownies

title: Fudgy Chewy Brownies

1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF.

title: Super Chewy Gooey Brownies

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF and line a 9‚àö√≥9-inch pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.

title: Super Gooey Brownies

directions:

title: Gooey Chocolate Brownies with Frosting
ingredients: For the Brownies: 1 cup melted butter, 1 cup cocoa powder, 2 cups white sugar, 4 eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, 1 cup flour, ¬¨¬∫ tsp salt; For the Frosting: ¬¨Œ© cup melted butter, ¬¨Œ© cup cocoa powder, ¬¨¬∫ cup water, 2 cups icing sugar

title: Gooey Brownies
ingredients: 1¬¨¬∫ cups white sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup butter (melted and cooled), 1 tbsp vanilla extract, ¬¨√¶ cup all-purpose flour, ¬¨Œ© cup unsweetened cocoa powder, ¬¨¬∫ tsp salt, ¬¨¬∫ tsp baking soda, 2 eggs, 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, ¬¨Œ© cup chopped walnuts, 1¬¨Œ© tbsp all-purpose flour
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line a 2.2-quart glass baking pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.

3. In another bowl, sift together ¬¨√¶ cup flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking soda.

5. Toss chocolate chips and walnuts with 1¬¨Œ© tbsp flour and fold into the batter. Pour batter into prepared pan and level off the top.

title: Thick and Gooey Brownies

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF and line a 9‚àö√≥9-inch pan with parchment paper.

3. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well. Stir in vanilla and coffee.

title: Chewy Brownies

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Butter and line an 8‚àö√≥8-inch baking tray with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, whisk melted butter, oil, sugars, eggs, and vanilla for about 5 minutes using an electric mixer until thick.
3. Sift flour and cocoa powder into the same bowl. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined.
4. Fold in half of the chocolate chunks. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Top with remaining chocolate chunks.

title: Easy One Bowl Fudgy Cocoa Brownies
ingredients: ¬¨Œ© cup butter (or oil), 1 cup sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, ¬¨¬∫ cup flour, ¬¨¬∫ tsp salt, ¬¨Œ© cup add-ins (chopped chocolate, chocolate chips, or walnuts)
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Grease an 8‚àö√≥8-inch square pan or a 9‚àö√≥5-inch loaf pan, or line with parchment or foil.
2. In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt butter. Add sugar and cocoa powder, and whisk for at least 1 minute until sugar dissolves.
3. Add eggs one at a time, then vanilla, and whisk for 1 minute until well combined and the batter is shiny.
4. Stir in flour and salt until fully combined, being careful not to overmix. Fold in any add-ins (chocolate chips, walnuts, etc.).

title: The Best Fudgy Brownies
ingredients: 10 tbsp butter, 1¬¨¬∫ cups granulated sugar, ¬¨√¶ cup plus 2 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder, ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, ¬¨Œ© tsp vanilla extract, 2 large eggs, ¬¨Œ© cup all-purpose flour
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8‚àö√≥8-inch square baking pan with parchment paper or foil and lightly grease.
2. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine butter, sugar, cocoa, and salt. Microwave in one-minute intervals, stirring in between, until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth.

title: Better Than Box Mix Brownies

title: Quick & Easy Brownies Like Box Mix

title: Better Than Box Mix Brownies

title: Boxed Brownie Recipe
ingredients: Brownie Mix: 2 cups powdered sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup all-purpose flour, ¬¨Œ© cup unsweetened cocoa powder, ‚Äö√ñ√¨ cup palm fruit shortening, ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, ¬¨¬∫ tsp vanillin; Wet Ingredients: 3 tbsp water, ¬¨Œ© cup sunflower oil, 2 eggs
directions:

title: Better Than Boxed Fudge Brownies

title: Starbucks Double Chocolate Brownies Copycat

title: 100 Hour Brownies
ingredients: Browned Butter: 1 cup butter, 1 tbsp espresso powder, 2 tbsp coffee ice cubes; Batter: 4 eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla paste, 2¬¨¬∫ cups sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup cocoa powder, 1¬¨Œ© cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsp kosher salt, 1 tbsp espresso powder, 8 oz 75% dark chocolate (melted), 3¬¨Œ© oz milk chocolate (chopped), 3¬¨Œ© oz 75% dark chocolate (chopped); Topping: 6 oz 75% dark chocolate (chopped)
directions:
1. Brown the butter in a nonstick saucepan until golden, then add espresso powder and coffee ice cubes to melt. Let cool.
2. In a large bowl, beat eggs, vanilla paste, and sugar with a hand mixer until light and fluffy.
3. Sift in cocoa powder, espresso, and salt. Stir in browned butter.
4. Add melted chocolate and sift in flour, folding gently. Stir in chopped chocolate.
5. Pour batter into a lined 9‚àö√≥13-inch pan. Top with dark chocolate shards.
6. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 72 hours. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF and bake for 30 minutes.
7. Remove from oven, wrap in foil, and freeze for 30 minutes. Then refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.

title: 100 Hour Brownies (The Flour Girl)
ingredients: 2 sticks unsalted butter, 1 ice cube, 4 eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 2¬¨¬∫ cups sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup Dutch-processed cocoa powder, 1 tbsp espresso powder, 1 tbsp kosher salt, 8 oz 75% cacao chocolate (melted), 1¬¨Œ© cups all-purpose flour, 3.5 oz milk chocolate (chopped), 3.5 oz 75% cacao chocolate (chopped), 6 oz semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions:
1. Melt butter in a pan, stirring constantly until golden brown and nutty-smelling. Remove from heat, add ice cube, and set aside.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat together eggs, vanilla, and sugar until thick and pale yellow.
3. Sift in cocoa powder, espresso powder, and salt, mixing well. Stir in browned butter and melted chocolate.
4. Sift in flour and mix. Fold in half the chopped chocolates and chocolate chips, reserving the rest.
5. Spread batter into a lined 8‚àö√≥11 or 9‚àö√≥13 pan. Scatter remaining chocolate over the top, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 3 days.
6. On the third day, preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Remove plastic wrap and bake for 35 minutes (or 30 minutes for a 9‚àö√≥13 pan).
7. After baking, top with foil and freeze for 30 minutes. Then refrigerate for 24 hours.
8. Warm individual slices before serving for the best experience.

equipment_needed: 8‚àö√≥11 or 9‚àö√≥13-inch pan, parchment paper, mixing bowl, spatula

title: 100 Hour Brownies (Bigger Bolder Baking)
ingredients: 2‚Äö√ñ√¨ cups bittersweet chocolate (chopped), 14 tbsp butter, 6 large eggs (room temperature), 2 cups dark brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, 1 cup all-purpose flour, ¬¨Œ© cup bittersweet chocolate (chopped)
directions:
1. Butter and line an 8-inch square pan with parchment paper. Melt 2‚Äö√ñ√¨ cups chocolate and butter in a large bowl. Let cool for 10 minutes.
2. Whisk in eggs, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. Fold in flour until combined.
3. Pour batter into the prepared pan and sprinkle the remaining ¬¨Œ© cup chopped chocolate over the top, pressing in slightly.
4. Cover with foil and refrigerate for 72 hours.
5. After 3 days, bake at 350¬¨‚àûF for 40 minutes until just set with a slight jiggle in the middle. Cover with foil and freeze for 30 minutes.
6. After freezing, refrigerate for 24 hours. Cut into squares and serve.

cleaned_texture: Fudgy with a rich chocolate flavor

title: 100 Hour Brownies (Kleinworth & Co)
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, 2 cups granulated sugar, 4 large eggs, 1¬¨Œ© cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup mini chocolate chips, Optional: ¬¨Œ© cup chopped nuts (walnuts or pecans)
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 325¬¨‚àûF. Grease and line a 9‚àö√≥13-inch pan with parchment paper.
2. In a saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Let cool for 5-10 minutes.
3. Beat eggs into the butter-sugar mixture one at a time. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, and salt, then gradually add to the wet ingredients.
4. Stir in vanilla extract. Fold in chocolate chips (and nuts if using).
5. Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out with a few moist crumbs.
6. Let Brownies cool completely in the pan, then cover and let rest at room temperature for 100 hours.
7. After 100 hours, lift the Brownies from the pan using the parchment overhang, cut into squares, and serve.

cleaned_texture: Deepened flavors and fudgy texture after 100 hours of resting

directions:

ingredients: ¬¨√¶ cup refined coconut oil or canola oil, ¬¨√¶ cup granulated sugar, ¬¨Œ© cup packed brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2 large eggs + 1 yolk, ‚Äö√ñ√Æ cup cocoa powder (sifted), ¬¨Œ© cup all-purpose flour, ¬¨Œ© tsp coarse sea salt, ¬¨¬∫ tsp baking powder, ¬¨¬∫ tsp espresso powder (optional), ¬¨Œ© cup dairy-free chocolate chips or chopped dairy-free chocolate
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. Line an 8‚àö√≥8 inch metal baking pan with parchment paper.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine oil, sugars, and vanilla. Mix on medium speed for 1 minute.
3. Add eggs and yolk one at a time, mixing after each addition. Mix for 30 seconds, rest for 3 minutes, then repeat two more times.
4. Whisk together cocoa powder, flour, salt, baking powder, and espresso powder. Add dry ingredients and chopped chocolate to wet mixture, mixing until combined.
5. Pour batter into the pan and bake for 25-35 minutes until a toothpick comes out with a few moist crumbs. Cool before slicing.

equipment_needed: 8‚àö√≥8 inch metal baking pan, parchment paper, stand mixer or handheld mixer
cleaned_texture: Rich and fudgy with dairyfree chocolate

title: Dairy-Free Brownies (Chenee Today)

directions:

title: Gluten-Free Dairy-Free Refined Sugar-Free Brownies (Salted Plains)

directions:

title: Dairy-Free Brownies (Savor the Spoonful)

title: Homemade Vegan Brownies (Eat With Clarity)

Dry Ingredients: ¬¨√¶ cup cocoa powder, 1¬¨Œ© cups all-purpose flour, ¬¨Œ© tsp salt, ¬¨Œ© cup chocolate chips
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF. In a small bowl, whisk 2 tbsp ground flax with 5 tbsp water and set aside to thicken.
2. In a medium pot, whisk together 1¬¨Œ© cups sugar and ¬¨Œ© cup water. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally for 5-10 minutes until sugar is fully dissolved.
3. In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients (except chocolate chips). Add dissolved sugar mixture and remaining wet ingredients, then stir to combine.

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350¬¨‚àûF (180¬¨‚àûC). Line a square pan with parchment paper and set aside.
2. Prepare flax egg by combining 2 tbsp ground flaxseed with 6 tbsp brewed coffee and let it sit for 10 minutes.

4. In a large mixing bowl, whisk vegan butter and coconut sugar. Add flax eggs, melted chocolate, vanilla extract, and mix until glossy.

directions:

title: moist Vanilla Cupcake recipe
ingredients: 1 23 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 14 tsp baking soda, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp kosher salt, 34 cup unsalted butter melted, 3 egg whites room temperature, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 12 cup sour cream room temperature, 12 cup whole milk warm, for the buttercream: 2 lb confectioners sugar, 1 lb unsalted butter room temperature, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tbsp heavy cream, 1 pinch kosher salt, 1 tsp whole milk
directions: preheat oven to 350 degrees f. place cupcake papers in a cupcake pan. sift the flour, sugar, salt, baking soda and powder into a large bowl, and whisk together. separate the eggs. in another bowl, whisk together the wet ingredients until combined. add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients. mix until combined. distribute the batter evenly into cupcake papers, filling each paper about 23 the way up. bake for 18 minutes or until centers are springy. for the buttercream: in a stand mixer, cream the butter. add confectioners sugar in two batches. add salt, milk, cream, and vanilla. mix until fluffy. pipe onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with moist vanilla flavor
equipment_needed: cupcake pan, stand mixer, piping bag, paddle attachment, whisk, bowls
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with moist vanilla flavor

title: Vanilla Cupcake recipe
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 14 tsp baking powder, 18 tsp salt, 2 large eggs room temperature, 34 cup castersuperfine sugar, 60g unsalted butter cubed, 12 cup full fat milk, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 12 tsp vegetable or canola oil
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a large bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt. set aside. heat butter and milk in a microwave until butter melts. cover and keep warm. in a separate bowl, beat eggs with a handheld mixer for 30 seconds, then gradually add sugar and beat until tripled in volume about 6 minutes. slowly add flour in three parts, mixing at low speed. temper the hot milk mixture with part of the egg batter and mix, then combine with the rest of the egg batter. mix until smooth and pourable. fill muffin tin 23 full and bake for 22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with rich vanilla flavor
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, whisk, handheld mixer, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with rich vanilla flavor

title: perfect Vanilla Cupcake recipe
ingredients: 1 14 cups all-purpose flour, 1 14 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 34 cup sugar, 2 large eggs room temperature, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 12 cup buttermilk or plain kefir room temperature
directions: preheat oven to 350f and line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. in a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt. set aside. in an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar on medium-high speed for 5 minutes until thick and fluffy. add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. add vanilla and beat to combine. reduce speed to medium and add the flour mixture in thirds, alternating with buttermilk. mix until just combined. divide batter evenly into 12-count muffin pan, filling 23 full. bake for 20-23 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely.
notes_on_texture: fluffy and moist vanilla flavor
equipment_needed: muffin pan, cupcake liners, whisk, electric mixer, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: fluffy and moist vanilla flavor

title: Vanilla Cupcake recipe
ingredients: 34 cup superfine sugar, 23 cup butter softened, 3 large eggs, 1 12 cups self-rising flour, 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper liners. in a large bowl, beat sugar and butter with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. stir in vanilla extract. add flour and mix until combined. spoon batter into muffin cups, filling each 34 full. bake for 18-20 minutes or until tops spring back when pressed. cool on a wire rack.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with a classic vanilla flavor
equipment_needed: muffin tin, paper liners, electric mixer, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with a classic vanilla flavor

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 23 cups all-purpose flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 12 cup unsalted butter melted, 1 large egg, 14 cup sour cream, 34 cup milk, 2 tsp vanilla extract; for the buttercream: 34 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 3-4 cups confectioners sugar powdered sugar, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 3 tbsp milk, pinch of kosher salt
directions: preheat oven to 350. line a cupcake pan with 12 liners. in a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt. in a large bowl, whisk sugar and melted butter until smooth. whisk in the egg, sour cream, milk, and vanilla extract. add dry ingredients and stir until incorporated. fill cupcake liners 23 full. bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. cool completely before frosting. for the buttercream: beat butter until smooth. add confectioners sugar, vanilla, and milk. beat on high speed for 3 minutes. adjust consistency with milk or sugar as needed. frost cupcakes as desired.
notes_on_texture: rich and creamy with a smooth vanilla flavor
equipment_needed: cupcake pan, cupcake liners, whisk, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: rich and creamy with a smooth vanilla flavor

title: easy homemade Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 14 cups all-purpose flour, 1 14 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt, 6 tbsp unsalted butter room temperature, 34 cup sugar, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract, 2 large eggs, 12 cup plus 2 tbsp milk; for the buttercream: 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 4 cups powdered sugar, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract, 2-3 tbsp milk or water, pinch of salt
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. in a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt. in a large bowl, beat butter, sugar, oil, and vanilla extract until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes. add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. add half of the dry ingredients, then gradually add milk, followed by the remaining dry ingredients. mix until smooth. fill cupcake liners 34 full and bake for 15-18 minutes. cool on a wire rack before frosting. for the buttercream: beat butter until smooth, then add half of the powdered sugar and mix. add vanilla, milk, and salt, then the remaining powdered sugar. mix until smooth. adjust consistency with milk or water as needed. pipe frosting onto cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with a smooth vanilla buttercream
equipment_needed: cupcake pan, cupcake liners, mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with a smooth vanilla buttercream

title: moist Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 cups granulated sugar, 12 cup vegetable oil, 3 large eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 12 cup sour cream, 2 12 cups all-purpose flour, 3 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, 1 14 cups milk; for the frosting: 1 12 cups unsalted butter, 5-6 cups powdered sugar, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 2 12 tbsp heavy cream, pinch of salt
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a cupcake pan with cupcake liners. in a large bowl, beat sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla extract for 2 minutes. mix in sour cream until combined. in a separate bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt. add half of the dry ingredients and half of the milk, then mix. add the remaining dry ingredients and milk, mixing until well combined. fill cupcake liners 23 full and bake for 14-16 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: whip cold butter for 5-7 minutes until fluffy. add powdered sugar in batches, alternating with vanilla and heavy cream. beat until fluffy. pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: moist and fluffy with rich vanilla buttercream
equipment_needed: cupcake pan, cupcake liners, stand mixer, piping bag, cookie scoop
cleaned_texture: moist and fluffy with rich vanilla buttercream

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 12 cups cake flour, 34 cup granulated sugar, 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract, 12 cup whole milk divided, 3 tbsp sour cream, 1 egg, 1 egg white; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter, 2 12 cups powdered sugar, 1 tbsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. sift cake flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. in a separate bowl, whisk 14 cup milk, sour cream, egg, and egg white. set aside. beat dry ingredients, butter, vanilla, and the remaining milk until moistened. add the wet ingredients in three additions, mixing after each. divide batter evenly into muffin cups. bake for 20-25 minutes. cool in pan for 15 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack. for the frosting: whip butter for 5 minutes. gradually add powdered sugar, then vanilla, and whip until light and fluffy. frost cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with smooth buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin pan, cupcake liners, stand mixer, whisk, piping bag
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with smooth buttercream frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 34 cups plain flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 34 cup caster sugar, 2 large eggs, 12 cup milk, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter softened, 1 12 cups powdered sugar, 1-1 12 tbsp milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, sprinkles
directions: preheat oven to 350f 180c. sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. in a separate bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. add eggs one at a time, beating well. add flour in two batches, then mix in vanilla and milk. divide batter evenly into a muffin tin. bake for 20-25 minutes. cool completely. for the frosting: beat butter and powdered sugar until thick. add vanilla and milk, beating until combined. pipe over cupcakes and decorate with sprinkles.
notes_on_texture: soft and moist with a rich buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: soft and moist with a rich buttercream frosting

title: classic Vanilla Cupcake with vanilla frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 13 cups flour, 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 1 cup sugar, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 1 egg white, 1 egg, 14 cup sour cream, 34 cup half and half cream, 2 tsp vanilla extract, seeds from 12 vanilla bean; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter softened, 4-5 cups powdered sugar, 14 cup heavy cream, 2 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a medium bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. in a separate bowl, whisk butter and sugar until grainy. add egg, egg white, sour cream, half and half, and vanilla extract. scrape seeds from half a vanilla bean and add to the batter. mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients. bake for 18-20 minutes. cool before frosting. for the frosting: beat butter for 3 minutes until creamy. gradually add powdered sugar, whipping cream, and vanilla. mix until smooth and adjust consistency if needed.
notes_on_texture: soft and moist with a creamy vanilla frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, hand mixer, whisk, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: soft and moist with a creamy vanilla frosting

title: simply perfect Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 34 cups cake flour, 34 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 1 cup granulated sugar, 3 large egg whites, 2 tsp vanilla extract, seeds from 12 vanilla bean, 12 cup sour cream, 12 cup whole milk; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter softened, 4-5 cups confectioners sugar, 14 cup heavy cream, 2 tsp vanilla extract, salt to taste, sprinkles
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. whisk cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. beat butter until creamy, then add sugar and beat until fluffy. add egg whites, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean seeds. mix in sour cream, then add dry ingredients on low speed. slowly pour in milk and mix until combined. fill liners 23 full and bake for 19-22 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: beat butter until creamy, then add confectioners sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt. frost cupcakes and decorate with sprinkles.
notes_on_texture: soft, fluffy, and perfectly moist with rich vanilla buttercream
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: soft fluffy and perfectly moist with rich vanilla buttercream

title: vanilla bean cupcakes
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 34 cup whole milk or cream, 1 vanilla bean or 1 tsp vanilla paste, 1 23 cups all-purpose flour, 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 12 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter melted, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 14 cup full fat yogurt or sour cream, 1 tsp vanilla extract; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter, 4-5 cups powdered sugar, 14-13 cup milk or cream, 1 vanilla bean or 1 tsp vanilla paste, 18-14 tsp salt
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. heat milk or cream with vanilla bean, then allow to steep for 30 minutes. in a large bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. in another bowl, beat melted butter, sugar, egg, yogurt, vanilla extract, and infused cream. slowly add dry ingredients and mix until just combined. fill liners 23 full and bake for 15-17 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: beat butter until creamy, then add powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, and salt. mix until smooth and adjust consistency as needed.
notes_on_texture: rich vanilla flavor with creamy buttercream
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, hand mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: rich vanilla flavor with creamy buttercream

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting easy and moist
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 cups cake flour, 2 tsp baking powder, 34 tsp salt, 1 cup unsalted butter, 1 cup granulated sugar, 4 large eggs, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract, 78 cup buttermilk; for the frosting: 1 12 cups salted butter, 3 cups powdered sugar, 3 tbsp heavy cream, 34 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a medium bowl, whisk together cake flour, baking powder, and salt. in a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. add eggs one at a time, mixing well. add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk, starting and ending with the flour mixture. mix in vanilla extract. divide batter evenly into the prepared pans and bake for 20 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter and powdered sugar until creamy. add heavy cream and vanilla extract and beat until light and fluffy. pipe onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: moist and tender with a light buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: moist and tender with a light buttercream frosting

title: homemade Vanilla Cupcakewith buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 12 cups flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt, 13 cup unsalted butter, 23 cup sugar plus 3 tbsp, 1 large egg, 23 cup milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract; for the frosting: 12 cup unsalted butter, 2 cups powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2 tbsp milk
directions: preheat oven to 300f. line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. in a large bowl, beat butter until creamy, then add sugar, egg, and vanilla extract, mixing after each addition. add half of the dry ingredients, followed by half of the milk. repeat with the remaining ingredients and mix until smooth. fill cupcake liners 34 full and bake for 26 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter until creamy, then add powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and milk. mix until smooth and pipe onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with a creamy buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with a creamy buttercream frosting

title: ultra Vanilla Cupcakewith easy vanilla frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 12 cups cake flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 tbsp cake enhancer optional, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt, 6 tbsp butter softened, 2 large eggs room temperature, 12 cup milk room temperature, 2 tsp vanilla extract; for the frosting: 6 tbsp butter softened, 13 cup vegetable shortening, 18 tsp salt, 4-5 cups confectioners sugar, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 14-13 cup milk room temperature
directions: preheat oven to 375f. grease or line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. in a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cake enhancer, baking powder, and salt. add butter and mix until crumbly. in another bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and vanilla. add wet ingredients to dry ingredients in two additions, mixing well. scoop batter into prepared pan. bake for 16-18 minutes, until lightly browned. cool for 5 minutes in pan, then transfer to a rack. for the frosting: beat butter, shortening, and salt. add 4 cups confectioners sugar, vanilla, and 2 tbsp milk. beat until fluffy, adding more milk or sugar as needed.
notes_on_texture: soft and fluffy with a creamy vanilla frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: soft and fluffy with a creamy vanilla frosting

title: the best Vanilla Cupcake recipe with chocolate fudge frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 14 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 13 cup unsalted butter softened, 34 cup granulated sugar, 1 tbsp sunflower oil, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 large egg, 14 cup sour cream, 12 cup whole milk; for the frosting: chocolate fudge frosting recipe
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. in a large bowl, beat butter, sugar, oil, and vanilla extract until creamy. add the egg and beat until incorporated, then mix in sour cream. add one-third of the dry ingredients, followed by half of the milk, and repeat. beat until smooth. divide the batter among the liners. bake for 18-20 minutes. cool completely before frosting. follow the instructions for the chocolate fudge frosting and frost the cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: soft, moist, and fluffy with rich chocolate fudge frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: soft moist and fluffy with rich chocolate fudge frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla bean buttercream
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 12 cups cake flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbsp dry milk powder, 1 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp kosher salt, 6 tbsp unsalted butter softened, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 14 cup warm water, 12 tsp vinegar, 12 cup sour cream, 2 large eggs, 1 egg yolk, 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste; for the buttercream: 1 cup unsalted butter, 6 cups powdered sugar, 3-4 tbsp milk, 12 tbsp vanilla bean paste
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. in a large bowl, combine cake flour, sugar, dry milk powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. add butter and oil and mix until combined. in a separate bowl, mix water, vinegar, and sour cream. beat in eggs and vanilla. slowly pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and mix until smooth. divide batter among the liners and bake for 15-17 minutes. cool before frosting. for the buttercream: beat butter until smooth. gradually add powdered sugar and milk, mixing after each addition. mix in vanilla bean paste and adjust consistency.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy with rich vanilla bean buttercream
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, piping bag, mixing bowls
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy with rich vanilla bean buttercream

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 eggs, 34 cup sugar, 12 cup vegetable oil, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract, 1 14 cups cake flour, 1 14 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp baking soda, 12 tsp salt, 12 cup buttermilk; for the frosting: 12 cup shortening, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 4 cups confectioners sugar, 2 tbsp milk, icing color optional
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar with an electric mixer. add oil and vanilla, then beat to combine. in a separate bowl, whisk together cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. add half of the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, followed by half of the buttermilk. repeat. divide batter among liners and bake for 12-14 minutes. for the frosting: beat shortening and butter until combined. add vanilla and confectioners sugar, beating well after each addition. add milk and beat until fluffy.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith whipped vanilla bean frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 12 cups all-purpose flour, 34 tsp salt, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 2 cups granulated sugar, 3 large eggs room temperature, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup buttermilk; for the frosting: 1 34 cups unsalted butter softened, 5-6 cups confectioners sugar, 3 tbsp milk, 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste, pinch of salt
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line muffin pans with cupcake liners. sift together flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda. cream butter and sugar until pale and fluffy, then add eggs one at a time, followed by vanilla extract. add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk, mixing until just combined. pour batter into liners and bake for 12-14 minutes. for the frosting: whip butter for 8 minutes, then add remaining ingredients and whip until light and fluffy. frost cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and fluffy cupcakes with creamy vanilla bean frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, electric mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: light and fluffy cupcakes with creamy vanilla bean frosting

title: perfect one-bowl Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 sticks unsalted butter softened, 1 tbsp vanilla, 2 cups granulated sugar, 4 large eggs, 1 cup sour cream, 12 cup whole milk, 3 14 cups cake flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp baking soda, 34 tsp salt; for the frosting: 2 sticks unsalted butter softened, 4-5 cups confectioners sugar, 14 cup whole milk, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 14 tsp salt
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line two cupcake tins with paper liners. in a large bowl, beat butter, vanilla, and sugar until light and fluffy. add eggs one at a time, then mix in sour cream and milk. toss cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then fold into the wet ingredients. fill liners halfway and bake for 18-20 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: beat butter until smooth. gradually add confectioners sugar, then mix in milk, vanilla, and salt. beat until fluffy, adjusting consistency as needed.
notes_on_texture: light, fluffy cupcakes with creamy vanilla buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: light fluffy cupcakes with creamy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 34 cups all-purpose flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt, 1 12 cups sugar, 1 cup unsalted butter softened, 4 large eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 cup milk; for the frosting: 4 12 cups powdered sugar, 1 12 cups unsalted butter softened, 18 tsp salt, 1-2 tbsp half  half, 1 tbsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line muffin pans with cupcake liners. in a bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt. in another bowl, beat sugar and butter until creamy. add eggs one at a time, followed by vanilla extract. alternate adding the flour mixture and milk, mixing until just combined. divide batter evenly into liners and bake for 16-20 minutes. for the frosting: beat powdered sugar, butter, and salt until creamy. add half  half and vanilla extract, and beat until smooth. frost cupcakes as desired.

title: vanilla bean cupcakes with vanilla buttercream
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 12 cup salted butter room temperature, 1 34 cups granulated sugar, 2 large eggs room temperature, 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste, 1 14 cups buttermilk room temperature, 2 12 cups all-purpose flour, 2 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt; for the buttercream: 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 4 cups powdered sugar, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 14 tsp salt, 4-6 tbsp heavy cream room temperature
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line two cupcake pans with 18 cupcake liners. in a stand mixer, cream butter and sugar for 5 minutes. add eggs and mix for 2 minutes. whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. whisk vanilla bean paste into buttermilk. alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to the batter, starting and ending with dry ingredients. fill liners 34 full and bake for 18-20 minutes, rotating halfway. cool completely before frosting. for the buttercream: cream butter for 10 minutes, then add vanilla and salt. add powdered sugar in two batches, followed by heavy cream until desired consistency.

equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag

title: basic Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla cream cheese icing
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 cup vegetable shortening, 1 34 cups sugar, 2 12 cups cake flour, 1 14 tsp salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup buttermilk, 2 12 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 12 tsp vinegar; for the icing: 1 stick butter softened, 1 package cream cheese softened, 4 cups powdered sugar, 14 tsp salt, 3 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line muffin tins with cupcake liners. cream shortening and sugar until fluffy. in a separate bowl, sift flour and salt. in another bowl, mix eggs, buttermilk, vanilla, baking soda, and vinegar. alternate adding flour mixture and buttermilk mixture to the shortening mixture. mix until combined. pour batter into liners and bake for 17-20 minutes. cool completely before icing. for the icing: mix butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, salt, and vanilla until smooth. ice cooled cupcakes.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 sticks unsalted butter softened, 1 cup caster sugar, 1 23 cups all-purpose flour, 34 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp baking soda, 12 tsp salt, 23 cup sour cream or crme frache, 2 eggs, 1 12 tsp vanilla extract; for the frosting: 2 sticks unsalted butter softened, 3 13 cups powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2 tbsp hot water
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a 12-cup muffin tin with cupcake liners. in a food processor, combine all cupcake ingredients and mix until smooth. alternatively, cream butter and sugar in a stand mixer, then add dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately, mixing until combined. divide the batter among liners and bake for 15-20 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: beat butter until pale yellow, then gradually add powdered sugar. add vanilla and hot water, and beat until smooth. pipe or spread frosting onto cupcakes.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith vanilla buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 3 14 cups cake flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, 34 tsp salt, 34 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 2 cups granulated sugar, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 14 cup vegetable oil, 4 large eggs room temperature, 1 18 cups full-fat buttermilk; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 14 tsp salt, 4 12 to 5 cups powdered sugar sifted, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 14 cup half  half or regular milk

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 12 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 34 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 1 large egg white, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp vanilla bean paste, 1 23 cup cake flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 12 cup sour cream, 12 cup buttermilk room temperature; for the frosting: 8 oz cream cheese room temperature, 12 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 3 cups powdered sugar, 12 cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk or heavy cream, 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 325f. line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. in a stand mixer, cream butter and sugar until fluffy. add eggs, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean paste, mixing well. sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. add half of the flour mixture and sour cream, followed by half the buttermilk. mix, then repeat with remaining flour and buttermilk. divide batter among liners and bake for 20-22 minutes. cool completely. for the frosting: beat cream cheese and butter until smooth. add powdered sugar, cocoa powder, milk, and vanilla. mix until combined. frost cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: soft Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate cream cheese frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag

title: moist yellow cupcakes with milk chocolate frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 2 large eggs separated, 2 14 cups sifted all-purpose flour, 2 12 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp salt, 34 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 1 34 cups granulated sugar, 3 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup whole milk room temperature; chocolate buttercream and sprinkles for decoration
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. beat egg whites until soft peaks form and set aside. whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. in a stand mixer, cream butter and sugar for 2-3 minutes. add egg yolks and vanilla, then alternate adding dry ingredients and milk. fold in whipped egg whites. divide batter among liners and bake for 18-21 minutes. cool completely before frosting with chocolate buttercream and sprinkles.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 23 cups all-purpose flour, 34 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp baking soda, 14 tsp salt, 12 cup unsalted butter softened, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 12 cup buttermilk, 3 tbsp sour cream; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter softened, 3-4 cups powdered sugar, 12 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 14 tsp salt, 3-4 tbsp whipping cream
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line muffin trays with papers. in a medium bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. in a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until fluffy. add eggs and vanilla, then mix in sour cream. add half of the dry ingredients, then mix in buttermilk. add remaining dry ingredients and mix until combined. fill liners 23 full and bake for 15-18 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter, then add powdered sugar, cocoa, vanilla, salt, and cream. frost cooled cupcakes.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 cup sugar, 2 cups flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 12 tsp salt, 2 eggs, 12 cup milk, 12 cup canola oil, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 12 cup boiling water or coffee; for the frosting: 1 stick butter softened, 4-5 cups powdered sugar, 12 cup cocoa powder, 2-3 tbsp cream, 100g dark chocolate melted
directions: preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tray with cupcake liners. sift together the dry ingredients. whisk the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla, then combine with dry ingredients. add boiling water and mix until smooth. divide batter into liners and bake for 20-25 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter until fluffy, then add powdered sugar and cocoa. add cream, then slowly add melted chocolate. beat until smooth and light. pipe onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: moist Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: moist Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate buttercream frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate buttercream frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 15 oz cake flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 34 tsp kosher salt, 6 large egg whites, 1 cup  2 tbsp half-and-half, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 7 12 oz unsalted butter cubed, room temperature, 1 lb granulated sugar; for the frosting: 1 12 cups granulated sugar, 14 cup  2 tbsp water, optional: 1 tsp corn syrup, 5 large egg whites, 1 lb unsalted butter cubed, room temperature, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 4 oz unsweetened chocolate melted, cooled
directions: preheat oven to 350f and line cupcake pans with liners. whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. whisk egg whites, half-and-half, and vanilla. cream butter and sugar until fluffy. alternate adding dry and wet ingredients. divide batter into liners and bake for 25 minutes. cool completely. for the frosting: heat sugar, water, and optional corn syrup until it reaches 235-240f. beat egg whites into soft peaks. slowly pour syrup into egg whites, then cool and add butter, vanilla, and melted chocolate. pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: light and airy Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate buttercream frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, digital thermometer, piping bag
cleaned_texture: light and airy Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate buttercream frosting

title: brown butter Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate frosting
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 1 14 cups all-purpose flour, 1 12 tsp baking powder, 14 tsp salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 12 cup browned unsalted butter, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 12 cup milk; for the frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter room temperature, 13 cup sunbutter, 2 cups powdered sugar, 12 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions: preheat oven to 350f and line a cupcake tray with 12 liners. whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar. mix eggs, vanilla, browned butter, oil, and milk in another bowl. add half the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, then add the rest. fill cupcake liners halfway and bake for 15-17 minutes. cool completely before frosting. for the frosting: cream butter and sunbutter. mix in powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and vanilla. pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: moist Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate frosting
equipment_needed: muffin tin, cupcake liners, stand mixer, mixing bowls, piping bag
cleaned_texture: moist Vanilla Cupcakewith rich chocolate frosting

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Bean Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup unsalted butter (softened), 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup milk, 1 vanilla bean (seeds scraped)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cupcake pan with liners. 2. In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients: gluten-free flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In another bowl, cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. 4. Add eggs one at a time, then vanilla extract and vanilla bean seeds. 5. Gradually add the dry ingredients alternately with milk, starting and ending with dry ingredients. 6. Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy with a hint of vanilla bean.
equipment_needed: Cupcake pan, cupcake liners, mixing bowls, hand mixer, spatula, measuring cups, and spoons.
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy with a hint of vanilla bean

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup unsalted butter (softened), 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup milk (or dairy-free milk)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cupcake pan with liners. 2. In a bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, baking powder, and salt. 3. In another bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. 4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition, then stir in vanilla extract. 5. Add the dry ingredients alternately with milk, mixing until just combined. 6. Divide the batter evenly among the liners and bake for 18-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
notes_on_texture: Soft and moist with a classic vanilla flavor.
equipment_needed: Cupcake pan, cupcake liners, mixing bowls, hand mixer, spatula, measuring cups, and spoons.
cleaned_texture: Soft and moist with a classic vanilla flavor

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: 125g gluten-free self-raising flour, 125g caster sugar, 125g unsalted butter (softened), 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 2 tbsp milk (or dairy-free milk)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a cupcake pan with liners. 2. In a bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. 3. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition, then add vanilla extract. 4. Sift in the flour and baking powder, then gently fold into the mixture. 5. Add milk and mix until smooth. 6. Divide the batter evenly into cupcake liners and bake for 18-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

title: Gluten-Free Vegan Vanilla Cupcake
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 2/3 cup almond milk, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cupcake pan with liners. 2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the almond milk and apple cider vinegar. Let sit for 5 minutes. 3. Add the sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the milk mixture and whisk until combined. 4. In another bowl, mix gluten-free flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until smooth. 6. title: Vegan Vanilla Vegan Vanilla Cupcake
ingredients: 1 cup (130g) all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/3 cup (80ml) neutral oil (like canola or sunflower), 2/3 cup (160ml) non-dairy milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin pan with paper liners. 2. In a large bowl, whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In a separate bowl, whisk the oil, non-dairy milk, vanilla, and apple cider vinegar. 4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. 5. Spoon the batter into the prepared liners, filling them about 2/3 full. 6. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. 7.
