title: Vegan Golden Vanilla Vegan Vanilla Cupcake
ingredients: 1 cup soy milk, 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar, 1 1⁄4 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3⁄4 teaspoon baking powder, 1⁄2 teaspoon baking soda, 1⁄4 teaspoon salt, 1⁄2 cup non-hydrogenated margarine (or neutral oil), 3⁄4 cup sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1⁄4 teaspoon almond extract (optional)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin pan with paper liners. 2. In a small bowl, combine the soy milk and apple cider vinegar; set aside to curdle. 3. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 4. In another bowl, beat together the margarine and sugar until creamy. Add the vanilla and almond extracts, then the soy milk mixture. 5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until smooth. 6. Fill the Vegan Vanilla Cupcake liners 2/3 full and bake for 20-22 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. 7. Cool completely before frosting.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate frosting

directions: preheat oven to 340f and line two cupcake pans with liners. beat oil, eggs, and sugar until fluffy. sift together flour and salt, then mix into the egg mixture. add milk and vanilla slowly. fill liners two-thirds full and bake for 15-20 minutes. for the frosting: beat powdered sugar, cocoa, butter, and salt until crumbly. slowly add milk and vanilla, then beat until fluffy. pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes and decorate.

title: classic Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate buttercream

directions: preheat oven to 425f and line cupcake pan with liners. whisk together flour, salt, and baking powder. in a large bowl, whisk milk, oil, vanilla, and egg until frothy. add sugars and whisk to dissolve. mix in dry ingredients until just combined. divide batter into liners, place in oven, and lower to 350f. bake for 15-20 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter and cocoa powder, add salt and vanilla, then add powdered sugar gradually. add milk 1 tbsp at a time to reach desired consistency. frost cooled cupcakes.

title: chocolate Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: for the cupcakes: 34 cup milk room temperature, 14 cup heavy whipping cream room temperature, 6 egg whites, 1 tsp almond extract, 1 tsp vanilla bean paste, 2 14 cups cake flour, 1 34 cups sugar, 4 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, 34 cup butter softened; for the frosting: 1 batch easy buttercream frosting
directions: preheat oven to 350f and line cupcake tins with paper liners. combine milk, cream, egg whites, almond extract, and vanilla bean. in a mixer, whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. add butter and beat until the mixture looks like wet sand. add half of the milk mixture and beat for 90 seconds, then add the rest and beat for 30 seconds. divide batter into cupcake wells and bake for 18-20 minutes. cool completely before frosting.

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate ganache buttercream

directions: preheat oven to 350f and line cupcake pans. sift flours, dried buttermilk, baking powder, and salt. cream butter, sugar, and cake enhancer. add vanilla and eggs, one at a time. alternate dry and wet ingredients, then bake for 20-22 minutes. cool cupcakes. for the ganache: pour hot cream over chopped chocolate, let sit for 3-5 minutes, and stir until smooth. let cool to room temperature. for the frosting: beat butter until fluffy, add powdered sugar, cocoa, vanilla, and cooled ganache. beat until smooth and adjust consistency. frost cupcakes with ganache buttercream.

directions: preheat oven to 350f and line a 12-count muffin tin with paper liners. cream butter and sugars until fluffy. add egg and vanilla. in a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. gradually fold in flour mixture and buttermilk in parts until combined. bake for 17-18 minutes. for the frosting: beat butter, add powdered sugar, vanilla bean paste, and heavy cream. beat until smooth. frost cooled cupcakes.

title: simple Chocolate Cupcake with vanilla frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith chocolate buttercream frosting

directions: preheat the oven to 350f. grease a 12-cup muffin tin. blend all cupcake ingredients in a high-powered blender until well combined and fluffy. fill muffin cups 34 full and bake for 20 minutes. cool on a rack. for frosting: melt chocolate in a double boiler. cream together butter, erythritol, cocoa, and vanilla. fold in melted chocolate. pipe frosting on cooled cupcakes.

directions: preheat oven to 350f and line a 12-cup muffin tin. in a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until fluffy. add eggs, sour cream, and vanilla. mix in flours and salt. stir in milk. scoop batter into muffin cups and bake for 16-18 minutes. for frosting, beat together butter, powdered sugar, cocoa, and melted chocolate. add cream and beat until fluffy. frost cupcakes after they cool.

title: Chocolate Cupcake with chocolate ganache icing
ingredients:
cupcakes:
1  cups all-purpose flour 210 g
2 cups granulated sugar 400 g
 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, preferably dutch processed 75 g
2 tsp baking soda 10 ml
1 tsp baking powder 5 ml
1 tsp salt  if morton, 5 ml
2 large eggs
2 tsp vanilla extract 10 ml
1 cup buttermilk 240 ml
 cup oil, canola or vegetable 120 ml
1 cup hot coffee 240 ml

chocolate ganache icing:
5 oz chopped dark chocolate
4 tbsp salted butter 57 g
 cup granulated sugar 150 g
 cup heavy cream 180 ml
2 tsp vanilla extract 10 ml
pinch of salt
directions:
cupcakes:
1. combine sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. stir with a whisk until evenly combined.
2. add vanilla, eggs, buttermilk, and oil. stir until combined.
3. add hot coffee and stir quickly. the batter will be thin.
4. pour batter into cupcake pan with liners and bake for 20 minutes at 350 f until a toothpick comes out clean.
5. set aside to cool.

ganache:
1. add chocolate, butter, salt, and vanilla into a bowl.
2. in a small pan over medium heat, heat cream and sugar until hot but not boiling.
3. pour the heated cream and sugar over the chocolate, and stir until smooth. cool slightly before using to frost the cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: moist and tender buttermilk chocolate cake with rich chocolate ganache.
equipment_needed: cupcake pan, whisk, mixing bowls, small pan, refrigerator
cleaned_texture: moist and tender buttermilk chocolate cake with rich chocolate ganache

title: the best Chocolate Cupcake
ingredients:
cupcakes:
5 oz 142 g bittersweet baking chocolate, finely chopped
13 cup 28 g dutch-process cocoa
1 tsp instant espresso powder
12 cup boiling water
34 cup 95 g all-purpose flour
12 cup 100 g granulated sugar
12 cup 100 g packed light brown sugar
12 tsp fine salt
12 tsp baking soda
12 cup 113 g sour cream or plain full fat yogurt, room temperature
14 cup vegetable oil
2 large eggs plus 1 egg yolk, room temperature
2 tsp white vinegar
1 tsp vanilla extract

frosting:
12 cup cold heavy whipping cream
4 oz finely chopped semisweet chocolate
3 sticks unsalted butter cool room temp
2 cups powdered sugar, sifted
1 cup dutch-process cocoa powder, sifted
2 tsp vanilla extract
14 tsp fine sea salt
directions:
cupcakes:
1. combine chocolate, cocoa powder, and espresso powder in a bowl. pour hot water over the mixture, cover and let stand for 5 minutes. whisk until smooth, then cool.
2. preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin tin with paper liners.
3. in a small bowl, whisk flour, sugars, salt, and baking soda.
4. whisk sour cream, oil, eggs, egg yolk, vinegar, and vanilla into the cooled chocolate mixture until smooth.
5. stir in the flour mixture until smooth without overmixing.
6. divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups. bake for 17-18 minutes. let cool for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.

frosting:
1. bring cream to a simmer. remove from heat and add chopped chocolate. let stand, stir until smooth, and cool.
2. in a mixer, beat butter, powdered sugar, cocoa, vanilla, and salt. add chocolate cream and beat until light.
notes_on_texture: moist Chocolate Cupcake with rich and smooth chocolate frosting.
equipment_needed: muffin tin, whisk, mixing bowls, small saucepan, stand mixer
cleaned_texture: moist Chocolate Cupcake with rich and smooth chocolate frosting

 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 25g
 tsp baking soda
 tsp salt

 cup vegetable oil 80ml

 cup 41g unsweetened cocoa powder

1. preheat oven to 350f. line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper cupcake liners.
2. whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
3. in another bowl, whisk buttermilk, oil, egg, and vanilla until well combined.
4. pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and whisk until smooth.
5. divide batter into cupcake liners, filling each about  full.
6. bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. cool on wire rack.

title: yellow cupcakes with chocolate buttercream
ingredients:
cupcakes:
2 12 cups all-purpose flour
2 12 tsp baking powder
1 tsp salt
1 cup unsalted butter, softened
1 14 cups granulated sugar
3 large eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract
23 cup milk

chocolate buttercream:
1 cup unsalted butter, softened
4 cups powdered sugar
12 cup cocoa powder
4 tbsp heavy cream
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 dash salt
directions:
cupcakes:
1. preheat oven to 350f. line a muffin pan with liners or spray with nonstick spray.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a large bowl, cream butter and sugar, then beat for 2 more minutes.
4. add vanilla extract, then eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. alternate adding flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture in thirds, mixing until well combined.
6. scoop batter into prepared muffin pan, filling each  full. bake for 22 minutes or until golden brown.
7. cool in pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.

buttercream:
1. in a large bowl, beat butter until smooth.
2. add powdered sugar and cocoa powder on low speed until well mixed.
3. add vanilla extract, heavy cream, and salt, then beat on medium-high until fluffy.
4. pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes.

cleaned_texture: soft yellow cupcakes with a fluffy chocolate buttercream

title: Chocolate Cupcake with vanilla buttercream

vanilla buttercream frosting half recipe

1. preheat oven to 325f. line a muffin pan with cupcake liners and lightly spray with cooking spray.

3. add milk, oil, egg, and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
4. carefully add boiling water and mix until smooth. the batter will be thin.

title: easy Chocolate Cupcake with chocolate buttercream

title: double Chocolate Cupcake with dark chocolate buttercream
ingredients:

1 tsp baking soda
12 tsp salt

1 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp instant coffee granules optional

2. in a large bowl, whisk flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. set aside.
3. in a measuring cup, stir buttermilk, vanilla, and coffee granules if using. set aside.
4. in a separate bowl, mix oil and sugar. add eggs and egg white one at a time, mixing for about 90 seconds.
5. alternate adding flour mixture and buttermilk mixture to the oil mixture, starting and ending with flour.

title: Chocolate Cupcake with chocolate buttercream and chocolate covered strawberries
ingredients:

1 cup sugar
34 cup milk

4. add flour mixture to egg mixture, alternating with milk, and mix until smooth.
5. pour batter into muffin pan, filling 23 full. bake for 18-20 minutes. cool completely before frosting.
6. for buttercream: combine powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and butter in an electric mixer. slowly add heavy cream, then beat on high until fluffy.
7. for strawberries: dip washed, dried strawberries into melted semi-sweet chocolate. drizzle with melted white chocolate.
8. assemble: pipe swirls of buttercream on cupcakes, top with chocolate-covered strawberries.

3. in a medium bowl, whisk eggs, granulated sugar, brown sugar, oil, and vanilla until smooth.
4. add half of the wet ingredients and half of the buttermilk to the dry ingredients. whisk gently, then add the remaining wet ingredients and buttermilk. stir until just combined. do not overmix.

1 tsp salt

title: Chocolate Cupcake with vanilla frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with vanilla buttercream frosting

cupcakes:

12 tsp baking soda
14 tsp salt
2 eggs, room temperature

12 cup brown sugar, packed
