title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Frosting
ingredients: For the Cupcakes: 3 ounces bittersweet chocolate, ‚Öì cup Dutch-processed cocoa powder, ¬æ cup hot coffee, ¬æ cup bread flour, ¬æ cup granulated sugar, ¬Ω teaspoon salt, ¬Ω teaspoon baking soda, 6 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 2 teaspoons white vinegar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract; For the Frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter, 2¬Ω cups powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 1 to 2 tablespoons heavy cream
directions: Make the Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard-size muffin pan with liners. Place the chopped chocolate and cocoa powder in a medium bowl. Pour the hot coffee over the mixture and whisk until smooth. Refrigerate mixture for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk together the flour, sugar, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl; set aside. Whisk the oil, eggs, vinegar, and vanilla extract into the cooled chocolate mixture until smooth. Add the flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Divide the batter evenly between the muffin pan cups. Bake until the cupcakes are set and just firm to the touch, 17 to 19 minutes. Cool the cupcakes in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes, then remove the cupcakes from the pan and place on the wire rack to cool completely, about 1 hour. Make the Frosting: Using the wire whisk attachment of your stand mixer, whip the butter on medium-high speed for 5 minutes, stopping to scrape the bowl once or twice. Reduce the speed to low and gradually add the powdered sugar. Once all of the powdered sugar is incorporated, increase the speed to medium-high and add the vanilla, mixing until incorporated. Whip at medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes, scraping the bowl as needed. Add the heavy cream a little at a time, whipping after added, until desired consistency is reached. Frost the cupcakes as desired.
notes_on_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with a smooth vanilla frosting.
equipment_needed: Standard muffin pan, wire whisk, stand mixer, wire rack, Wilton 1M decorating tip
cleaned_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with a smooth vanilla frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Frosting (ChiselandFork)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 1 large egg, ¬º cup + 2 tablespoon buttermilk, ¬º cup vegetable oil, 2 tablespoon sour cream, ¬Ω tablespoon vanilla extract, ¬æ cup all-purpose flour, ¬æ cup granulated sugar, ¬Ω cup unsweetened cocoa powder, ¬æ teaspoon baking powder, ¬æ teaspoon baking soda, ¬Ω teaspoon kosher salt, 3 tablespoon hot black coffee, ¬º cup mini semi-sweet chocolate chips; Vanilla Frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter, 3 cups powdered sugar, 2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tablespoon heavy cream
directions: Chocolate Cupcake: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line 12 muffin tins with paper liners. Set aside. In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, beat together the egg, buttermilk, vegetable oil, sour cream, and vanilla extract until smooth. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Add the flour mixture and mix on low speed until there are no longer any clumps. Add the coffee and mix until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour the batter ‚Öî full among the muffin tins and bake for 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean. When cupcakes are done, remove immediately from tins and leave on a cooling rack to cool completely before frosting. Top with sprinkles if desired. Vanilla Frosting: In a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, mix butter and sugar. Mix on low speed until blended and then increase speed to medium and beat for about 3 minutes. Add vanilla extract and heavy cream and continue to beat on medium speed for 1 more minute, adding some more cream if needed for spreading consistency. Place in fridge until ready to use on cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with creamy vanilla frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with paddle and whisk attachment, muffin tin, cooling rack, paper liners
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with creamy vanilla frosting

title: Basic Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Frosting (WildWildWhisk)
ingredients: Chocolate Cake: 1 ¬º cup all-purpose flour, ¬Ω cup cocoa powder (half natural/half Dutch-processed), 1 cup granulated sugar, ¬º teaspoon kosher salt, ¬Ω teaspoon baking powder, ¬Ω teaspoon baking soda, 1 cup buttermilk (room temperature), ¬º cup vegetable oil, 1 large egg (room temperature), 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract; Vanilla Frosting: 12 oz unsalted butter (3 sticks, room temperature), 1 ¬Ω cup powdered sugar (sifted), 6 tablespoon heavy whipping cream, 1 ¬Ω teaspoon pure vanilla extract (or vanilla bean paste), a big pinch of salt
directions: Make the cake batter: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and line a muffin pan with cupcake liners and set aside. In a small mixing bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda. Stir in the salt and mix with a whisk to distribute evenly. Set aside. Add buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg, and vanilla extract to a medium bowl. Beat together with a whisk until smooth. Add the flour mixture to the wet ingredient mixture and fold until just combined. Use a large ice cream scoop to divide batter into the muffin pan. One flat scoop of batter for each cupcake cavity, or about ¬º cup of batter each. Bake in the middle oven rack for 17-18 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a cupcake comes out clean. Remove from the oven and allow to cool to the touch, then remove cupcakes from the pan and allow to cool completely on a wire rack. Make the vanilla frosting: Add butter, cream, vanilla bean paste, and salt to the stand mixer bowl. Sift in powdered sugar. Stir to incorporate all of the ingredients, then increase the mixer speed gradually to high and beat until the frosting is white and fluffy, about 5-15 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, standard size muffin pan, large cookie scoop, open star piping tip, pastry bags, kitchen scale
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Buttercream (Life's Ambrosia)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup canola oil, 1 cup buttermilk, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1 cup boiling water; Vanilla Buttercream: 1 cup unsalted butter (softened), 4 cups powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2-3 tablespoons whole milk, vanilla sugar for sprinkling
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a cupcake tin with cupcake liners. In a bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine sugar, flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix together. Add in canola oil, buttermilk, and vanilla. Mix on medium speed just until it starts to come together. Mix in eggs one at a time. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Slowly pour in boiling water. Mix for 2 more minutes. Batter will be thin. Fill cupcake liners 2/3 way full. Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove cupcakes from oven and allow to cool completely. Make frosting by creaming together butter and powdered sugar in a stand mixer. Beat in vanilla extract. Beat in two tablespoons of milk and continue beating until a thick spreadable mixture forms. If frosting seems too thick, add the remaining tablespoon of milk. Spoon frosting into a piping bag and pipe onto cooled cupcakes. Sprinkle with vanilla sugar. Serve.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with paddle attachment, cupcake tin, cupcake liners, piping bag
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy vanilla buttercream

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Bean Buttercream (A Treats Affair)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 2 eggs, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup grapeseed or vegetable oil, 1/2 cup milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, pinch of salt; Vanilla Bean Buttercream: 1 cup butter (room temperature), 1 vanilla bean, 3 cups powdered sugar, 1-2 tablespoons heavy cream (optional)
directions: Heat the oven to 375¬∞F. Line 10 cupcake cups with paper baking cups. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, add the eggs, sugar, and vegetable oil. With the paddle attachment on, beat on medium-high speed for 1 to 2 minutes or until well mixed. In a small bowl, combine the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Alternately add the flour mixture with the milk and beat until blended. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cupcake cups. Bake in the preheated oven for 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and cool completely on a wire rack. To make the vanilla bean buttercream: In a mixing bowl, add the butter. With the paddle attachment on, beat on low speed until light and fluffy (about 3-5 minutes). Split the vanilla bean lengthwise into two halves with a sharp paring knife, and scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean halves. Add the vanilla seeds to the creamed butter. Gently beat in the powdered sugar, a little at a time. When all the sugar is added, increase the mixer's speed to medium-high and beat for 2-3 more minutes. If the frosting is too thick, add a few drops of heavy cream until the desired consistency is reached. Spoon the frosting into a piping bag fitted with a frosting tip and frost the cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a light and fluffy vanilla bean buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with paddle attachment, cupcake tin, paper baking cups, piping bag, frosting tip
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a light and fluffy vanilla bean buttercream

title: Classic Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Frosting (Deliciously Sprinkled)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: ¬æ cups all-purpose flour, ¬Ω cup unsweetened cocoa powder, ¬Ω teaspoon baking powder, ¬º teaspoon baking soda, ¬º teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup granulated sugar, ¬Ω cup unsalted butter (softened), 1 ¬Ω teaspoons vanilla extract, ¬Ω cup sour cream; Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: 1 ¬º cups butter (softened), 5 cups powdered sugar, ‚Öì cup heavy whipping cream, 3 teaspoons vanilla extract, sprinkles for topping
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a cupcake pan with 12 cupcake liners. Set aside. In a medium bowl, mix flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl, using an electric or stand mixer on medium speed, beat eggs and sugar for about 2 minutes, or until light and creamy. Add the butter and vanilla extract and beat on low speed for about 1 minute, or until well blended. Beat in the dry ingredients on low speed until blended. DO NOT OVER MIX! Add the sour cream and beat until smooth. For the Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: Mix softened butter on medium speed with an electric or stand mixer. Beat for 30 seconds until smooth and creamy. Add powdered sugar, heavy whipping cream, and vanilla extract. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes. Add more cream if needed for spreading consistency. Frost cooled cupcakes using a piping bag or knife. Top with sprinkles.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with creamy vanilla buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Electric or stand mixer, cupcake pan, cupcake liners, piping bag or knife
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with creamy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Buttercream Frosting (Sweet Fix Baker)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 2 1/2 cups cake flour, 3/4 cup Dutch process cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil, 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 3 large eggs (room temperature), 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1/2 cup sour cream (room temperature), 1 cup freshly brewed strong coffee; Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter (room temperature), 6 1/4 cups powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup heavy whipping cream, 1/4 cup sprinkles (optional)
directions: Preheat your oven to 400¬∞F. Line your cupcake tins with cupcake liners and set aside. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl with the paddle attachment, beat oil and sugar for 1 minute at medium speed. Add eggs one by one, beating after each addition. Add vanilla and sour cream and beat until just combined. Add the hot coffee and the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating them. Start and finish with the dry ingredients and beat until just combined, scraping the bottom of the bowl. Do not overbeat. Divide batter into the paper liners, filling them 2/3 full. Use an ice cream scoop or cookie scoop for evenly sized cupcakes. Bake for 5 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350¬∞F and bake for an additional 7-10 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool for 1 minute in the cupcake tin, then place the unfrosted cupcakes over a wire rack to cool completely. For the Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: In a large mixing bowl using the whisk attachment, cream butter for 1.5 minutes on medium-high speed, or until light and fluffy. Sift the powdered sugar. Turn to low speed and gradually add the powdered sugar, vanilla extract, salt, and heavy cream until just combined. Turn the speed to high and beat for an additional minute. Scrape the sides of the bowl to ensure all of the ingredients are well-mixed. Frosting should look light and fluffy. Fill a piping bag with your frosting, pipe a swirl on top of the completely cooled cupcakes, and top with sprinkles or chocolate chips.
notes_on_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Electric mixer, 2 cupcake tins, piping bag, 1M piping tip
cleaned_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Buttercream Frosting (Healthy GF Family)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup + 1/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 egg, 1/2 cup strong black coffee, 1/2 cup buttermilk or sour milk, 1/4 cup canola oil, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract; Vanilla Frosting: 1 box confectioner sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla, 1/2 stick butter, 4 1/2 tablespoons milk; Chocolate Frosting: 6 tablespoons butter, 3/4 cup cocoa, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 2/3 cups powdered sugar, 4-6 tablespoons milk; Strawberry Frosting: 1 box confectioner sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/2 stick butter, 1-2 tablespoons milk, 3 tablespoons strawberry puree
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line muffin tins with baking cup liners. In a large mixer bowl, blend sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add egg, coffee, buttermilk, oil, and vanilla; beat on medium speed for 2 minutes (batter will be thin). Pour or spoon batter into prepared muffin tins. Bake for 17 minutes, then cover loosely with foil and bake another 5-10 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely and frost as desired. Vanilla Frosting: In a small mixing bowl, beat butter. Add remaining ingredients, and mix until combined and creamy. Chocolate Frosting: In a small mixer bowl, beat butter. Add powdered sugar and cocoa alternately with milk; beat to spreading consistency. Blend in vanilla. Strawberry Frosting: In a mixing bowl, beat the butter. Add remaining ingredients and mix until well combined and creamy.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with rich vanilla, chocolate, or strawberry frosting.
equipment_needed: Large mixer bowl, muffin tins, baking cup liners, electric or stand mixer
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with rich vanilla chocolate or strawberry frosting

title: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Buttercream (The Farm Chicks)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 2 cups granulated sugar, 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 3/4 cups cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup boiling water; Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: 1/3 cup butter, 3 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 2-4 tablespoons milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, food coloring (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Fill muffin pans with 24 cupcake liners. Add all ingredients, except the boiling water, into a mixing bowl. Beat with a hand blender, stand mixer, or by hand with a wire whisk until batter is completely combined and smooth. Add the boiling water and whisk just until blended. Evenly ladle (or pour) the batter into the liners. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the center of the cupcakes spring back when lightly touched. Cool and frost. Vanilla Buttercream Frosting: Beat butter in a medium-sized mixing bowl until creamy. Gradually beat in 3 cups of the powdered sugar. Beat in milk and vanilla. Blend in remaining 1/2 cup powdered sugar. If desired, tint with food coloring for a pastel effect.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with light and creamy vanilla buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Hand blender, stand mixer, wire whisk, muffin pans, cupcake liners
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with light and creamy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Bean Buttercream (Love to be in the Kitchen)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1/2 cup Dutch-processed cocoa powder, 1 cup boiling hot water, 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 cup granulated white sugar, 2 large eggs, 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract; Vanilla Bean Buttercream: 2 sticks unsalted butter (softened), 1 vanilla bean (halved lengthwise) or 1 tablespoon vanilla bean paste, 3 cups powdered sugar, pinch of salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons heavy cream (or milk)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Lightly butter or line 16 muffin cups with paper liners. In a small bowl, stir until smooth the boiling hot water and the cocoa powder. Let cool to room temperature. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Then, in the bowl of your electric mixer or with a hand mixer, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating until smooth. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture and beat only until incorporated. Then slowly and carefully add the cooled cocoa mixture and stir until smooth. Fill each muffin cup about two-thirds full with batter and bake for 18-20 minutes or until risen, springy to the touch, and a toothpick inserted into a cupcake comes out clean. Remove from oven and place on a wire rack to cool. Vanilla Bean Buttercream Frosting: In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the butter at medium-high speed until smooth, about 20 seconds. If using a vanilla bean, scrape seeds from the vanilla bean into the butter. If using vanilla bean paste, add it instead. Beat mixture at medium-high speed to combine, about 15 seconds. Add powdered sugar and salt; beat at medium-low speed until most of the sugar is moistened, about 1 minute. Scrape down the bowl and beat at medium speed until mixture is fully incorporated, about 30 seconds. Add vanilla and heavy cream, and beat at medium speed until incorporated, about 20 seconds, then increase speed to medium-high and beat until light and fluffy, about 4 minutes, scraping down bowl once or twice. Once the cupcakes have completely cooled, top with this frosting using a small spatula or a piping bag with a Wilton 1M open star tip.
notes_on_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy and light vanilla bean buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, whisk attachment, muffin cups, paper liners, hand mixer, piping bag, Wilton 1M open star tip
cleaned_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy and light vanilla bean buttercream frosting

title: Double Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Frosting (Foodal)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 3/4 teaspoon baking powder, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 3/4 cup water, 3/4 cup buttermilk, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 cup mini chocolate chips; Vanilla Frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter (softened), 4 cups confectioners‚Äô sugar, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 tablespoon heavy cream, mini chocolate chips and chocolate candy for garnish (optional)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line two 12-cup muffin pans with paper liners and set aside. Sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, buttermilk, oil, and vanilla extract. With a spatula, mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just incorporated, scraping down the sides and bottom as necessary. You will still see some small lumps of dry ingredients. Fold in the chocolate chips. Divide batter evenly among muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until the tops are fully set and spring back when touched. Remove from the oven, and let the cupcakes cool in the pan for 5 minutes before placing them on a wire rack to cool completely. Vanilla Frosting: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, mix the softened butter on medium speed until smooth. Sift the confectioners‚Äô sugar into a separate bowl. Add one cup at a time to the butter, beating very well after each addition. Add the salt, vanilla, and heavy cream. Mix on medium-high speed until very light and fluffy, approximately 5 minutes. Decorate as desired immediately on the completely cooled cupcakes, using mini chocolate chips as garnish.
notes_on_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla frosting and optional chocolate garnish.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with paddle attachment, spatula, muffin pans, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Rich Chocolate Cupcake with fluffy vanilla frosting and optional chocolate garnish

title: Chocolate Cupcake (Food & Wine)
ingredients: Chocolate Cupcake: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup water, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup + 2 tablespoons unsweetened natural cocoa powder, 3/4 teaspoon baking soda, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 large egg, 1/4 cup buttermilk, 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
directions: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper or foil liners. In a medium saucepan, melt the butter with the vegetable oil and water over low heat. In a large bowl, sift the flour with the sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the melted butter mixture and beat with a handheld mixer at low speed until smooth. Add the egg and beat until incorporated, then add the buttermilk and vanilla and beat until smooth, scraping the bottom and side of the bowl. Pour the batter into the lined muffin tins, filling them about three-fourths full. Bake the cupcakes in the center of the oven for about 25 minutes, until springy and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool slightly, then transfer them to a rack to cool completely.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a soft crumb.
equipment_needed: Medium saucepan, handheld mixer, muffin tin, paper or foil liners
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a soft crumb

title: Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Buttercream (The Hearty Life)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 1 large egg (room temperature), 1 cup milk or cream, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon kosher salt; Buttercream: 1 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 4-5 cups powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 2-3 tablespoons heavy whipping cream
directions: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and line a 12-cup cupcake pan. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Whisk to combine and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the oil, sugar, egg, and vanilla. Whisk to combine until light and creamy. Slowly mix in the milk. Add the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and mix well until completely combined. Use a portion scoop to fill each cupcake liner 2/3 full. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before frosting. Buttercream: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or using an electric hand mixer, cream the butter until light and fluffy (3-4 minutes). Add in the powdered sugar, one cup at a time, mixing thoroughly each time. Mix in the vanilla extract and the heavy cream, one tablespoon at a time until the desired consistency is reached. Frost the cooled cupcakes and top with chocolate curls or a chocolate chunk.
notes_on_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a light and creamy vanilla buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with paddle attachment, electric hand mixer, 12-cup cupcake pan, portion scoop
cleaned_texture: Moist Chocolate Cupcake with a light and creamy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Vanilla Cupcakewith Vanilla Buttercream (Baran Bakery)
ingredients: Vanilla Cupcakes: 1 1/2 cups cake flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup canola oil, 1/4 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 large egg (or 2 large egg whites), 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/3 cup whole milk (room temperature); Vanilla Buttercream: 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup water, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste, 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt
directions: Vanilla Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (177¬∞C) for convection or 325¬∞F (163¬∞C) for conventional. Line 13 muffin tins with cupcake liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the cake flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar until evenly distributed. Add the oil and butter to the dry ingredients and beat together until combined. Add the egg, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean paste and mix until fully combined. Add the sour cream and turn the mixer to low speed, while streaming in the milk. Scrape the edge of the bowl and mix just until the cupcake batter is smooth. Fill each cupcake liner about 2/3 to 3/4 full (about 50-55 grams of batter per cupcake). Bake for 16-18 minutes, until the center of the cupcake springs back when pressed or a toothpick comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let them cool in the cupcake pan for 10 minutes, then move them to a cooling rack to cool completely before frosting. Vanilla Buttercream: Place the sugar and water in a medium saucepan and swirl until the sugar is fully immersed. Place the saucepan over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and comes to a gentle simmer. Reduce the heat to low and place the lid on the pan to simmer for a couple of minutes. Meanwhile, place the eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and turn to high speed. Use a candy thermometer to check when the sugar reaches 240¬∞F (116¬∞C), then lower the mixer to medium speed and slowly drizzle the hot sugar syrup into the foamy eggs. Turn the mixer back up to high speed and let it whip for 5-10 minutes, until very pale and fluffy. Turn to medium speed and add butter 2 tablespoons at a time, mixing until combined and smooth. Scrape the bowl, add vanilla and salt, and turn the mixer to high speed for 1-2 minutes. Switch to a paddle attachment and mix at low speed for 5-10 minutes to remove air bubbles. Use a piping bag to frost the cooled cupcakes. Top with sprinkles, gold luster dust, or edible gold foil.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean buttercream.
equipment_needed: Vanilla bean paste, Kitchen Aid 5 qt. stand mixer, kitchen scale, Ateco #8 star piping tip, disposable piping bags, muffin pan
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakewith Chocolate Frosting (Butternut Bakery)
ingredients: Vanilla Cupcakes: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter (room temperature), 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 1 1/2 cups gluten-free baking flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 3/4 cup buttermilk; Chocolate Frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 3 cups powdered sugar, 2-3 tablespoons milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, rainbow sprinkles
directions: Vanilla Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and line one cupcake tin with 12 liners and another with 3 liners (for a total of 15 cupcakes). In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then set aside. In a mixing bowl using a hand or stand mixer with the paddle attachment, mix together the butter and 1/2 cup of the sugar on medium-high speed until smooth, light, and fluffy. Mix in the remaining sugar and vegetable oil until smooth, followed by the eggs and vanilla. Dump in half of the dry ingredients and mix. With some flour still showing, pour in the buttermilk and mix again. Dump in the rest of the dry ingredients and mix until smooth and well combined. Scoop the batter into the liners, filling each about halfway. Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until a toothpick in the center comes out clean with a few moist crumbs. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for about 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack. Let cool completely before frosting. Chocolate Frosting: In a bowl using a hand or stand mixer with the paddle attachment, add the butter and cocoa powder and mix until smooth. Scrape down the bowl and begin to mix in the powdered sugar one cup at a time, adding a tablespoon of milk between each cup, along with the vanilla and salt. The frosting should be thick but smooth and glossy. If too thick, add another tablespoon or two of milk. Pipe the frosting on the cooled cupcakes and top with sprinkles.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a rich chocolate frosting.
equipment_needed: Hand or stand mixer with paddle attachment, cupcake tin, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a rich chocolate frosting

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakewith Vanilla Buttercream (Mama Knows Gluten Free)
ingredients: Vanilla Cupcakes: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter (softened, or dairy-free alternative), 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs, 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract, 1 1/4 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour blend (with xanthan gum), 1 3/4 teaspoons gluten-free baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup milk (or dairy-free alternative such as almond, cashew, or coconut milk); Vanilla Buttercream: 3/4 cup unsalted butter (softened, or dairy-free alternative), 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 4 cups confectioners‚Äô sugar, 3 tablespoons milk (or dairy-free alternative such as almond, cashew, or coconut milk)
directions: Vanilla Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line a muffin pan with liners or spray with gluten-free nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add the sugar and beat until smooth. Add the eggs and vanilla extract, mixing until fully combined and smooth. Add the gluten-free flour, baking powder, and salt, and mix until combined. Pour in the milk and mix for 2 minutes on medium until the batter is smooth. Scoop the cake batter into the lined muffin pan using a greased ice cream scoop. Bake for 25 minutes, checking with a toothpick to ensure they are done. Allow the cupcakes to completely cool on a cooling rack before frosting. Vanilla Buttercream: In a large bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add the vanilla extract and mix until fully combined. Add the confectioners‚Äô sugar one cup at a time, mixing until fully combined. Add the milk and beat until the frosting is smooth and spreadable. Fill a piping bag with the frosting and frost the cooled cupcakes using a Wilton 1M frosting tip.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Large mixing bowl, hand or stand mixer, muffin pan, cupcake liners, cooling rack, piping bag, Wilton 1M frosting tip
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakewith Buttercream Frosting (Meaningful Eats)
ingredients: Dry Ingredients: 2 1/4 cups gluten-free 1:1 baking flour, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt; Other Ingredients: 1/2 cup butter (room temperature), 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 4 eggs (room temperature), 2 tablespoons vanilla extract, 1 1/3 cups buttermilk; Frosting: 1 cup butter (room temperature), 1.5 pounds powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 4 tablespoons whole milk
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and place paper liners in every other liner of 2 cupcake tins. Lightly grease with cooking spray and set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment (or using a large bowl with an electric mixer), beat the softened butter and oil together until homogeneous (about 3 minutes). Slowly add the sugar to the oil and butter while running the mixer on medium-low. Beat on high until the mixture is light, fluffy, and pale yellow (about 3 minutes). Add the eggs one at a time, scraping down the bowl in between additions. Mix in the vanilla extract, then beat on high for another 2 minutes to incorporate air. With the mixer running on low, alternate adding the dry ingredients with the buttermilk in 4 additions, starting with the buttermilk and ending with the dry ingredients. Fill each liner 3/4 full. This recipe makes about 20 cupcakes, so refrigerate the rest of the batter to bake after the first batch if needed. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean with moist crumbs. Repeat with remaining batter if needed. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. Frosting: In a stand mixer, beat the softened butter and powdered sugar until fluffy (about 2 minutes). Add in the vanilla, salt, and a tablespoon of milk one at a time, stopping if the frosting becomes too runny. Beat for 3 minutes until light and fluffy. Transfer the frosting to a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip and frost the cooled cupcakes. Top with sprinkles if desired.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a light and fluffy buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer with whisk attachment, large mixing bowl, cupcake tins, paper liners, pastry bag, large star tip
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a light and fluffy buttercream frosting

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Eat With Clarity)
ingredients: Wet Ingredients: 1/4 cup oil (refined avocado or any neutral oil), 1/4 cup butter (melted), 3/4 cup + 2 tablespoons granulated cane sugar, 1/2 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy), 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 tablespoon vanilla extract; Dry Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups gluten-free all-purpose baking flour, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt; Frosting: 2-3 cups buttercream frosting
directions: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the eggs, vanilla, oil, melted butter, milk, and sugar with an electric mixer. Add in the remaining dry ingredients and beat until a batter forms. Spoon and level the flour, do not scoop directly from the bag. Let the batter sit for 5 minutes. Use a cookie scoop, ice cream scoop, or regular spoon to add the batter to a lined muffin tray, filling each about 3/4 of the way up. Bake for 16-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let cool in the cupcake tray for 10 minutes, then carefully remove and finish cooling on a cooling rack. Spread or pipe buttercream over the cooled cupcakes and enjoy!
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a soft crumb.
equipment_needed: Large mixing bowl, electric mixer, muffin tray, cupcake liners, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a soft crumb

title: Perfect Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcakewith Vanilla Buttercream (Let Them Eat GF Cake)
ingredients: Vanilla Cupcakes: 3/4 cup butter (room temperature), 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 3 large eggs (room temperature), 1 tablespoon vanilla bean paste (or vanilla extract, or seeds from one vanilla bean), 1/2 teaspoon almond extract, 1 1/4 cups sour cream, 2 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour blend, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt; Vanilla Buttercream: 3 cups butter (room temperature), 6 cups powdered sugar (sifted), 1 tablespoon vanilla bean paste (or vanilla extract, or seeds from one vanilla bean)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and line muffin tins with paper liners (makes about 20 cupcakes). In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then set aside. Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl. Add the sour cream, vanilla, and almond extract, beating just until combined. Reduce the speed to low and mix in the dry ingredients a little at a time until all of it is added. Fold in any unmixed flour by hand. Scoop the batter into the cupcake liners and bake for 20-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pans for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Vanilla Buttercream: In the bowl of a stand mixer (or using a handheld mixer), beat the butter until smooth and creamy. Add powdered sugar in increments with the mixer on low, then add the vanilla. Turn the mixer up to medium and beat for 5-6 minutes, until lighter in color and texture. Frost the cooled cupcakes as desired.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or handheld mixer, muffin tins, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Bean Cupcakes (Gluten Free Palate)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 1/4 cups all-purpose gluten-free flour blend, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 3/4 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 cup dairy-free milk (or dairy milk), 2 teaspoons gluten-free vanilla extract (or vanilla bean paste); Frosting: 1/2 cup dairy-free butter (or dairy butter), 1 teaspoon gluten-free vanilla extract, 3 cups powdered sugar, 2 tablespoons dairy-free milk (or dairy milk)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and position the rack in the center. Line a cupcake pan with paper liners and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, combine oil and sugar. Add the eggs and beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for one minute. Add the flour, salt, baking powder, dairy-free milk, and vanilla extract (or paste); beat at medium speed for one minute. Spoon the batter evenly into the cupcake liners. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until the centers spring back when touched and the cupcakes are lightly browned. Let cool in the pan on a rack for five minutes, then remove from the pan and let cool completely before frosting. Frosting: In a medium mixing bowl, beat the dairy-free butter and vanilla until smooth and creamy. Gradually add powdered sugar, one cup at a time, beating well. Alternate adding powdered sugar and 1 tablespoon of dairy-free milk until all ingredients are blended. Beat in additional dairy-free milk if needed to obtain the desired consistency. Frost the cooled cupcakes and enjoy!
notes_on_texture: Soft gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean frosting.
equipment_needed: Electric mixer, cupcake pan, paper liners, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Soft glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean frosting

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Mama Gourmand)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 8 tablespoons unsalted butter (melted and cooled), 2/3 cup whole milk (room temperature), 4 large egg whites (room temperature), 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour, 1 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 3 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt; Frosting: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1/2 cup shortening, 4 cups powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
directions: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Prepare two 12-cup muffin pans with paper liners (recipe makes approximately 22 cupcakes). Melt the butter and allow it to cool. Once cooled, whisk together the butter, milk, egg whites, and vanilla in a bowl. In a large bowl or stand mixer fitted with a paddle, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until well combined. Add all but 1/2 cup of the liquid mixture to the dry ingredients. Beat on low to moisten ingredients, then increase speed to medium for 2 minutes until the batter becomes pale and fluffy. Pour in the remaining 1/2 cup of liquid and beat for 1 minute longer. Distribute the cake batter evenly between the prepared cupcake tins, filling each no more than 2/3 full. Bake for 18-20 minutes, rotating halfway through, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let cool in the pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before frosting with vanilla or chocolate buttercream.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a soft crumb.
equipment_needed: Cup4Cup gluten-free flour, muffin tins, stand mixer, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a soft crumb

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Gluten Free on a Shoestring)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose gluten-free flour blend, 3/4 teaspoon xanthan gum (omit if blend contains it), 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 8 tablespoons unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 egg (room temperature), 1 egg white (room temperature), 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 2/3 cup milk or buttermilk (room temperature); Frosting: 8 tablespoons unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, milk by the teaspoon as necessary
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 325¬∞F. Line 16 wells of standard muffin tins with cupcake liners or grease the wells, and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, xanthan gum, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then set aside. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, or a large bowl with a handheld mixer, beat the butter, sugar, egg, egg white, and vanilla at medium-low speed to combine. Increase the speed to medium-high and beat until the mixture appears whipped (about 2 minutes). Add the dry ingredients in 3 batches to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk or buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Beat lightly after each addition until just combined, without overmixing. The batter should be light and fluffy. Fill the prepared wells of the muffin tin about 2/3 full. Shake the tin back and forth to distribute the batter evenly. Bake in the center of the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, until very lightly golden brown and springing back when pressed lightly in the center. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the tin for at least 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Repeat with the remaining cupcake batter. Frost only when completely cooled. Frosting: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy (about 30 seconds). Add the confectioners‚Äô sugar, salt, vanilla, and 1 teaspoon of milk, and beat on medium speed until well-combined (about 1 minute). Beat in more confectioners‚Äô sugar until thick but not stiff, then beat on high for about 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Frost the cooled cupcakes using a piping bag or by scooping a dollop with two spoons.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or handheld mixer, muffin tin, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vanilla buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Well Fed Baker)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 1/3 cups gluten-free 1-to-1 flour blend, 1 cup sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 eggs (room temperature), 6 tablespoons olive oil (or other light flavored oil), 2/3 cup non-dairy milk, 2 teaspoons vanilla; Buttercream: 3/4 cup vegan butter (room temperature), 3 cups powdered sugar (sifted), 1 tablespoon non-dairy milk, 2 teaspoons vanilla
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt until well combined. In a second bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients and mix until all the flour is incorporated. Divide the batter among the 12 cups using a spoon or measuring spoon. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-22 minutes, until the tops spring back when gently poked. Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool for at least one hour before frosting. Buttercream: Cut the vegan butter into cubes and place it in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on medium speed until the butter is soft and smooth, then scrape down the bowl. Add the sifted powdered sugar and beat on the lowest speed until incorporated, until it looks like thick paste. Add the vanilla and milk, and beat on medium-low speed until the milk is incorporated. Turn the mixer to high speed and beat for 4-5 minutes until the buttercream is very light in color and has increased in volume.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vegan buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Electric mixer, muffin pan, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vegan buttercream frosting

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Cake by Katie)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 2 1/2 cups gluten-free 1:1 flour blend, 3 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon fine sea salt, 1/2 teaspoon xanthan gum (omit if using regular flour or GF flour blend with xanthan gum), 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 2/3 cup dairy-free sour cream or plain yogurt (room temperature), 1/2 cup canola or vegetable oil, 3 large eggs (room temperature), 3/4 cup dairy-free milk (room temperature), 1 tablespoon vanilla extract; Buttercream: 2 cups salted dairy-free butter (room temperature), 5 1/2 cups icing sugar, 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon fine sea salt, optional: purple gel food color or white-white icing color
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and prepare two cupcake pans with liners (24 total cupcakes). In the bowl of a stand mixer or a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, sour cream, oil, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix on high for 2 minutes. Add the flour, baking powder, salt, and xanthan gum (if using) and start mixing on low. While the mixer is on low, slowly pour in the milk and mix until just combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Divide the batter evenly into the prepared cupcake pans, filling each liner about 2/3 to 3/4 full. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Buttercream: In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, cream the butter on high speed until light and fluffy (about 10 minutes). Add in the icing sugar, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix on low until combined. Turn the mixer to high and mix for 5 minutes until smooth and fluffy, scraping down the sides as necessary. For bright white frosting, add a small amount of purple gel food color to the buttercream and mix on high. Repeat if needed, adding a tiny bit at a time.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, cupcake pans, paper liners, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth vanilla buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Cupcake(Chelsweets)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 1/3 cup gluten-free flour, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup sour cream (room temperature), 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1 large egg (room temperature), 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste or vanilla; Buttercream: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste or vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 3/4 cups powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon heavy cream or whipping cream
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and place 12 cupcake liners in a cupcake pan. In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the water, sour cream, vegetable oil, egg, and vanilla. Whisk together the wet ingredients until they start to combine, then gradually mix them into the dry ingredients. Mix for a couple of minutes to help give the batter structure. Let the batter sit for 30 minutes to allow the gluten-free flour to absorb moisture. Fill the cupcake liners about 2/3 full, dividing the batter evenly. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack. Buttercream: Beat the butter on medium speed for 30 seconds until smooth. Mix in the vanilla and salt on low speed. Slowly mix in the powdered sugar and heavy cream on low until fully incorporated, scraping the bowl as needed. Continue to mix on low for a minute until smooth. Adjust consistency by adding more cream or powdered sugar if needed. Pipe large swirls of buttercream onto the fully cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: Soft gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a creamy vanilla bean buttercream.
equipment_needed: Cupcake pan, paper liners, electric mixer, cooling rack, piping bag
cleaned_texture: Soft glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a creamy vanilla bean buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Vanilla Bean Cupcakes (Gluten Free Palate)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 1/4 cups all-purpose gluten-free flour blend, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 3/4 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 cup dairy-free milk (or dairy milk), 2 teaspoons gluten-free vanilla extract (or vanilla bean paste); Frosting: 1/2 cup dairy-free butter (or dairy butter), 1 teaspoon gluten-free vanilla extract, 3 cups powdered sugar, 2 tablespoons dairy-free milk (or dairy milk)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and position the rack in the center. Line a cupcake pan with paper liners and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, combine oil and sugar. Add the eggs and beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for one minute. Add the flour, salt, baking powder, dairy-free milk, and vanilla extract (or paste); beat at medium speed for one minute. Spoon the batter evenly into the cupcake liners. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until the centers spring back when touched and the cupcakes are very lightly browned. Let cool in the pan on a rack for five minutes, then remove from the pan and let cool completely before frosting. Frosting: In a medium mixing bowl, beat the dairy-free butter and vanilla until smooth and creamy. Gradually add powdered sugar, one cup at a time, beating well. Alternate adding powdered sugar and 1 tablespoon of dairy-free milk until all ingredients are blended. Beat in additional dairy-free milk if needed to obtain the desired consistency. Frost the cooled cupcakes and enjoy!
notes_on_texture: Soft gluten-free Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean frosting.
equipment_needed: Electric mixer, cupcake pan, paper liners, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Soft glutenfree Vanilla Cupcakewith a smooth and creamy vanilla bean frosting

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Beyond Frosting)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 3 large eggs, 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract, 1/2 cup sour cream, 2 cups measure-for-measure all-purpose gluten-free flour, 1/2 cup natural cocoa powder, 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 1/4 cups brewed coffee; Frosting: 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter (cold), 6 cups powdered sugar, 2 1/2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, pinch of salt
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line a cupcake pan with liners. In a large mixing bowl, combine sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed until well combined and lighter in color. Mix in the sour cream and beat until well combined. In a separate bowl, sift together the dry ingredients. Alternate adding half of the dry ingredients with half of the coffee, mixing until combined, and repeat with the remaining ingredients. Use a spatula to scrape down the sides of the bowl and stir the batter to ensure it is well mixed. Divide the batter evenly, filling each liner about 2/3 full. Bake for 14-16 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool completely. Frosting: Cut the butter into pieces and whip it with the paddle attachment for 5-7 minutes, scraping down the bowl occasionally, until very fluffy. Alternate adding 2 cups of powdered sugar at a time with the vanilla extract and heavy cream, ensuring it is well combined. Whip for 1-2 minutes before adding more powdered sugar. Finally, increase the speed to medium-high and beat for another 3-5 minutes to incorporate air. Pipe the frosting onto cooled cupcakes and top with sprinkles.
notes_on_texture: Moist and fluffy gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy vanilla buttercream.
equipment_needed: Cupcake pan, paper liners, electric mixer, spatula
cleaned_texture: Moist and fluffy glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy vanilla buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Meaningful Eats)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 cup gluten-free measure-for-measure flour, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon instant espresso powder (optional), 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup neutral oil, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup hot water; Frosting: 1/2 cup butter (room temperature), 3-4 cups powdered sugar, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 cup heavy cream or milk of choice, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon almond extract, pinch of kosher salt
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line a standard muffin pan with paper liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, espresso powder (if using), and salt. Add the sugar, oil, eggs, sour cream, and vanilla to the bowl of a stand mixer or use a hand mixer. Mix on medium-high speed until well combined. With the mixer running on low, slowly add the dry ingredients in 3 additions, mixing after each addition. Gradually pour in the hot water and mix on medium speed for 2-3 minutes until smooth, scraping down the sides and bottom as needed. Portion the batter evenly into the prepared baking cups using a kitchen scoop or large spoon. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean with a few moist crumbs. Let the cupcakes cool in their pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Frosting: In a stand mixer or using a hand mixer, beat the butter on medium-high speed until creamy (about 2 minutes). Add 3 cups powdered sugar, cocoa powder, cream/milk, vanilla extract, almond extract, and salt. Mix on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to medium-high speed and whip for 2 minutes. Adjust the frosting consistency by adding more cream/milk or powdered sugar as needed. Frost the cooled cupcakes as desired.
notes_on_texture: Rich and moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or hand mixer, muffin pan, paper liners, kitchen scoop, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Rich and moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream

title: Easy Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Gluten Free Palate)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar, 2 cups all-purpose gluten-free flour blend, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa, 1 1/2 teaspoons gluten-free baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup milk (or dairy-free milk), 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons gluten-free vanilla extract, 3/4 cup boiling water; Frosting: 1/2 cup butter (or dairy-free butter), 1 1/2 teaspoons gluten-free vanilla extract, 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 4 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/4 cup milk (or dairy-free milk)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Position rack in the center. Line two 12-serving cupcake pans with paper liners. In a large mixing bowl, stir together sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until no clumps remain. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla, and beat with a mixer on medium speed for two minutes. Stir in the boiling water. Spoon batter evenly into the cupcake wells. Bake for 20-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely. Frosting: In a medium mixing bowl, beat the butter and vanilla until smooth and creamy. Add cocoa powder and beat until combined. Gradually add powdered sugar, one cup at a time, then slowly beat in milk. Adjust frosting consistency by adding additional milk if needed. Frost the cooled cupcakes as desired.
notes_on_texture: Moist and rich gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or hand mixer, cupcake pans, paper liners, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Moist and rich glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream

title: Perfect Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Gluten Free on a Shoestring)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 3/4 cup all-purpose gluten-free flour blend, 1/2 teaspoon xanthan gum (omit if blend contains it), 9 tablespoons unsweetened natural cocoa powder, 3/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 4 tablespoons vegetable or other neutral oil, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1/2 cup lukewarm water or milk (room temperature); Ganache Frosting: 3/4 cup heavy whipping cream, 10 ounces dark chocolate (chopped)
directions: Ganache Frosting: In a small heavy-bottom saucepan, heat the heavy whipping cream until it begins to simmer. Place the chopped chocolate in a medium bowl and pour the hot cream over it. Allow it to sit for about a minute until the chocolate begins to melt, then mix until smooth and glossy. Let the ganache cool at room temperature until firm enough to scoop with a spoon. Cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and line the wells of a 12-cup muffin tin. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, xanthan gum, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Create a well in the center and add the oil, eggs, and water (or milk), whisking until smooth. The batter should be relatively thin. Fill the wells of the prepared muffin tin about 2/3 full and shake to distribute the batter evenly. Bake for about 19 minutes, or until the cupcakes spring back when lightly pressed in the center. Let the cupcakes cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Right before frosting, transfer the cooled ganache to a large bowl and beat with a mixer until thickened and fluffy. Add additional cream by the teaspoon if the ganache is crumbly. Frost only the cupcakes you plan to serve immediately. Store unfrosted cupcakes in the freezer, and frost after defrosting at room temperature.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a rich and fluffy whipped ganache frosting.
equipment_needed: Muffin tin, paper liners, heavy-bottom saucepan, handheld or stand mixer, whisk attachment, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a rich and fluffy whipped ganache frosting

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake with Vanilla Buttercream (Stuck on Sweet)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose gluten-free flour, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 cups granulated sugar, 4 large eggs (room temperature), 1 cup vegetable oil, 2 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 1 1/4 cups water; Frosting: 1 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 3 1/2 - 4 cups confectioners sugar, 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 2-3 tablespoons milk (whole milk used)
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 325¬∞F and line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Add the eggs, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and water, and mix until just combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. The batter will be runny. Fill the cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake for 16-18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with few crumbs. Let cool completely. Frosting: In a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the butter on medium-high speed for a few minutes. With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the confectioners sugar until incorporated. Add vanilla extract and 2 tablespoons of milk, then increase the speed to medium-high and whip for 3-7 minutes until fluffy and creamy. Add more milk if the frosting seems too dry. Pipe the frosting onto cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a fluffy vanilla buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, muffin pan, cupcake liners, whisk attachment
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a fluffy vanilla buttercream frosting

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake with Chocolate Buttercream (Mama Knows Gluten Free)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 cup all-purpose gluten-free flour, 1/4 teaspoon xanthan gum (omit if flour contains it), 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon gluten-free baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional), 1/4 cup butter (softened), 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1 large egg, 1/3 cup cocoa powder, 1/3 cup boiling water; Frosting: 1 cup butter, 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract, 1 cup cocoa powder, pinch of salt, 4 cups powdered sugar, 3 tablespoons milk
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line a muffin pan with liners or spray with gluten-free non-stick spray. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together with a mixer until fluffy. Add the egg and mix until combined. Add the buttermilk and vanilla extract and mix until fully combined. In a medium bowl, combine the gluten-free flour, xanthan gum, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon (optional). Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until fully combined, scraping down the sides as needed. Mix in the cocoa powder, then add the boiling water and mix until smooth. Scoop the batter into the lined muffin pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. Frosting: In a large bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add vanilla and almond extract, and mix until combined. Add cocoa powder and mix until fully combined. Gradually add powdered sugar, one cup at a time, and mix until fully combined. Add the milk and beat until smooth and spreadable. Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes using your favorite piping tip.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Muffin pan, paper liners, stand mixer or hand mixer, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream frosting

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Eat with Clarity)
ingredients: Cupcakes: Wet Ingredients: 2/3 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup light brown sugar, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1/3 cup oil (olive oil recommended), 2/3 cup boiling water, 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar; Dry Ingredients: 3/4 cup + 2 tablespoons Bob's Red Mill GF 1:1 All Purpose Baking Flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2-1 teaspoon espresso powder (optional); Buttercream: 1/2 cup butter (room temperature), 2-3 tablespoons milk, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1/2 cup cocoa powder (or more to taste), 2-3 cups powdered sugar, sprinkles for topping
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line a muffin tray with liners. In a large bowl, whisk together all dry ingredients. Beat in all wet ingredients on medium speed until well combined, making sure to mix in all of the dry ingredients. The batter will be on the thinner side. Use a cookie scoop or spoon to fill the 12 lined cupcake tins about 3/4 of the way full. Bake for 18-22 minutes, checking at 18 minutes with a toothpick to see if it comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for 10-15 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling. Buttercream: Beat the room temperature butter with an electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in the cocoa powder. Gradually beat in 2 cups of powdered sugar, then beat in 2 tablespoons of milk and vanilla. Adjust the frosting to taste by adding more cocoa powder or powdered sugar as desired. Frost the cooled cupcakes using a piping tip or a knife.
notes_on_texture: Moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a fluffy chocolate buttercream.
equipment_needed: Muffin tray, paper liners, electric mixer, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a fluffy chocolate buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake with Chocolate Buttercream (Mile High Mitts)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 1 cup gluten-free flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 3 tablespoons coconut oil (melted), 1 cup sugar, 2 large eggs, 1 cup almond milk (or milk of choice), 1/2 teaspoon vanilla; Frosting: 1/2 cup butter (softened), 2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 2 tablespoons water, 1 teaspoon vanilla
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F and line two muffin tins with 15 cupcake liners. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients (flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, baking soda) until there are no clumps. Alternatively, sift the cocoa powder through a fine mesh strainer to remove clumps. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the coconut oil and sugar. Add the eggs, milk, and vanilla, and whisk to combine. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and stir until well incorporated. Pour the batter into the cupcake liners, filling each about 2/3 full. Bake for 14-16 minutes, or until the cupcakes are springy to the touch and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting. Frosting: In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter with a hand mixer until creamed. Add powdered sugar, cocoa powder, water, and vanilla, and beat until smooth. If necessary, add more water to achieve a smooth consistency. Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes, and add sprinkles if desired before the frosting sets.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream.
equipment_needed: Muffin tins, paper liners, hand mixer, fine mesh strainer
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake (Chelsweets)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 3/4 cup hot water, 1/3 cup milk or dark chocolate chips (melted), 1 tsp instant espresso or coffee, 1/3 cup baking cocoa powder, 3/4 cup gluten-free flour, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1 tsp white vinegar, 1 tsp vanilla extract; Frosting: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (room temperature), 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 cup melted dark chocolate (cooled), 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 cup heavy cream
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) and place 12 cupcake liners in a cupcake pan. Add hot water to a large bowl and pour in the melted chocolate chips, instant espresso, and sifted cocoa powder. Whisk together until combined. Sift in the dry ingredients (gluten-free flour, granulated sugar, salt, baking soda) and stir until combined. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add eggs, vegetable oil, vinegar, and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth. Mix the batter for an additional 2 minutes to build structure. Cover and let the batter sit for 30 minutes to allow the flour to absorb the liquid. Fill cupcake liners 3/4 full and bake for 18-19 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then move to a cooling rack to finish cooling. Frosting: Beat the butter on medium speed for 30 seconds with a paddle attachment until smooth. Mix in the vanilla extract and salt on low speed. Gradually add powdered sugar in two installments, alternating with the heavy cream. Mix in the cooled, melted chocolate. Beat on low until fully incorporated. Adjust consistency by adding more cream or powdered sugar as needed. Pipe a swirl on top of each cooled cupcake.
notes_on_texture: Rich and moist gluten-free Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Cupcake pan, paper liners, hand mixer or stand mixer, cooling rack, piping bag
cleaned_texture: Rich and moist glutenfree Chocolate Cupcake with a creamy chocolate buttercream frosting

title: Super Moist Chocolate Cupcake (Sally's Baking Addiction)
ingredients: Cupcakes: 3/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup unsweetened natural cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon espresso powder or instant espresso, 3/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs (room temperature), 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup packed light brown sugar, 1/3 cup vegetable or canola oil (or melted coconut oil), 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 1/2 cup buttermilk (room temperature); Frosting: chocolate buttercream and sprinkles for decorating
directions: Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (177¬∞C) and line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners, with a second pan lined with 2 liners (makes about 14 cupcakes). In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, espresso powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, brown sugar, oil, and vanilla until smooth. Add half of the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, then half of the buttermilk, and gently whisk. Repeat with the remaining wet ingredients and buttermilk, stirring until just combined. Do not overmix. The batter will be thin. Pour or spoon the batter into the liners, filling only halfway. Bake for 18-21 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool completely before frosting. Frost with chocolate buttercream using an icing knife or piping tip such as Wilton 1M. Store leftover cupcakes in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
notes_on_texture: Super moist Chocolate Cupcake with a rich chocolate buttercream frosting.
equipment_needed: Muffin pan, paper liners, mixing bowls, whisk, piping tip (optional)
cleaned_texture: Super moist Chocolate Cupcake with a rich chocolate buttercream frosting

title: Vegan Chocolate Vegan Chocolate Cupcake
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups (156g) all-purpose flour, 1 cup (200g) sugar, 1/3 cup (28g) cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup (240ml) almond milk, 1/3 cup (80ml) vegetable oil, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin pan with paper liners. 2. In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In a separate bowl, mix the almond milk, oil, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla extract. 4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until smooth. 5. Divide the batter evenly among the Vegan Chocolate Cupcake liners, filling each about 2/3 full. 6. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 7. Let cool completely before frosting.
notes_on_texture: Rich, moist, and chocolaty.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, muffin pan, paper liners
cleaned_texture: Rich moist and chocolaty

title: Easy Vegan Chocolate Vegan Chocolate Cupcake

title: Easy Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake
ingredients: 2 cups granulated sugar, 1¾ cups gluten-free all-purpose flour, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1½ teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 2 large eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 cup boiling water
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients. Stir in boiling water. Spoon batter into cupcake pans. Bake for 20-22 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Perfect bakery-style texture—moist and tender.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, electric mixer, cupcake pans, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Perfect bakerystyle texturemoist and tender

title: Perfect Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake

directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients. Mix until smooth. Fill muffin tins. Bake for 19 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Deep and chocolatey without being too rich.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, handheld mixer, muffin tins, paper liners, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Deep and chocolatey without being too rich

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Cupcake
ingredients: 1 cup sugar, ½ cup hot water, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, ½ cup sour cream, 1 cup gluten-free baking flour, ½ cup cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix wet and dry ingredients separately. Combine and mix. Pour into lined cupcake tins. Bake for 20 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Rich and fudgy with a tender crumb.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, electric mixer, cupcake tins, paper liners
