title: Perfect Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed, 2 1/2 tablespoons water, 1/2 cup salted vegan butter softened, 1/2 cup cane sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour, 2 teaspoons cornstarch or arrowroot powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1-1 1/2 cup dairy-free chocolate chips or chunks, Flaky salt (optional)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350F. Line a large baking tray with parchment paper or a silicone mat. 2. Prepare the flax “egg” by mixing flaxseed and water, set aside for at least 5 minutes. 3. Cream the butter, cane sugar, and brown sugar together on low speed for 3 to 5 minutes until fluffy. 4. Add the flax “egg” and vanilla, beat again until combined. 5. Mix in flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder, and salt until a thick dough forms. Fold in the chocolate chips. 6. Form 12 cookies, ~3 tbsp dough per cookie, and place on baking sheet. 7. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, let cookies rest on the baking sheet for another 10 minutes to cool.
notes_on_texture: Soft and chewy
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, baking tray, parchment paper, silicone mat, spatula
cleaned_texture: Soft and chewy

title: Love and Lemons Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon sea salt, 1 cup packed brown sugar, ½ cup melted coconut oil, ⅓ cup tahini, 6 tablespoons water, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1 heaping cup dark chocolate chips
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until combined. In a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, coconut oil, tahini, water, and vanilla until smooth. Pour the dry ingredients into the bowl of wet ingredients and use a spatula to combine. Fold in the chocolate chips. Use a 2-tablespoon cookie scoop to scoop the dough onto the baking sheets. Bake, one sheet at a time, for 12 to 14 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for at least 10 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Chewy, nutty flavor from tahini
equipment_needed: 2 baking sheets, parchment paper, spatula, whisk, cookie scoop
cleaned_texture: Chewy nutty flavor from tahini

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies - Purely Kaylie
ingredients: 1/2 cup vegan butter, 1 cup light brown sugar, 3 tbsp granulated sugar, 1/4 cup plant-based milk, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup vegan chocolate chips
directions: 1. Cream butter and sugars together. Add milk and vanilla. 2. Fold in flour, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chips. 3. Chill dough for 30 minutes. 4. Scoop dough onto baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes, let cool for 5 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with soft, chewy, and gooey center
equipment_needed: Handheld mixer or stand mixer, baking sheet, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with soft chewy and gooey center

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies from The Loopy Whisk
ingredients:
▢1/3 cup + 1/2 tbsp (70 g) caster or granulated sugar
▢1/2 cup + 2 tbsp (120 g) light brown sugar
▢1/3 cup + 2 tbsp (110 mL) vegetable or sunflower oil
▢4 tbsp non-dairy milk (such as almond, oat, rice or soy milk)
▢1/2 tsp vanilla paste (I love vanilla bean paste because it gives a very intense flavour and you only need a small amount, but you can also use 1 - 2 tsp vanilla extract)
▢1 3/4 cups + 1 tbsp (220 g) plain all-purpose flour
▢1 tsp baking powder
▢1/2 tsp baking soda
▢pinch of salt
▢3 1/2 oz (100 g) dark chocolate chips, chunks, wafers or chopped dark chocolate (I love Guittard's 64% and 72% chocolate wafers, as they give wonderful pools of melted chocolate – you can use either, depending on how bitter-sweet you like your chocolate)
directions:
In a bowl, whisk together the sugars, oil, non-dairy milk and vanilla.
Sift in the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Mix well until you get a smooth cookie dough with no flour clumps (shouldn't be sticky to the touch).
Add in most of the chocolate (set some aside for adding on top of cookies during baking) and mix well until evenly distributed.
Scoop the cookie dough using an ice cream or cookie scoop. Refrigerate the scoops of cookie dough for at least 1 hour or overnight (in a closed container).
Pre-heat the oven to 355 ºF (180 ºC) and line a baking sheet with baking/greaseproof paper.
Place the scoops of cookie dough onto the lined baking sheet, with at least 1 inch (2.5 cm) between them, as they will spread during baking.
Bake the cookies at 355 ºF (180 ºC) for 10 to 12 minutes. This gives the perfect balance between crispy edges and a gooey/fudgy middle.
The banging makes the cookies flatter, and gives them that characteristic crackly appearance, while adding more chocolate on top ensures they come out of the oven with GLORIOUS pools of melted chocolate.
Allow the baked cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 to 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
notes_on_texture: Perfect balance between crispy edges and a gooey/fudgy middle.
equipment_needed: Ice cream or cookie scoop, wire cooling rack, baking/greaseproof paper
cleaned_texture: Perfect balance between crispy edges and a gooeyfudgy middle

title: Vegan Copycat Tollhouse Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup vegan butter (2 sticks – room temperature), ¾ cup granulated sugar, ¾ cup packed brown sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, 2 tablespoons finely ground flax meal, 1/4 cup water (room temperature), 1 teaspoon coconut oil or plain vegetable oil
directions:
1. In a bowl mix together the dry ingredients with a whisk to remove any large lumps and set aside.
2. Make the rich flax egg by whisking the flax meal into the water until completely combined then whisk in the oil. Set aside for five minutes to thicken.
3. In a separate bowl using a stand or hand mixer, cream the butter for a few minutes to lighten it. Add the sugars and continue to mix for one to two minutes scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Add the flax egg mixture and vanilla and blend until fully incorporated.
4. Add the flour mixture all at once and mix just until there are a few streaks of flour left. Add the chips and combine just until the dough is smooth and there’s no traces of flour left.
5. You can bake the cookies immediately but I’ve found they do benefit from some refrigeration. Refrigerate the dough overnight for best results.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and scoop the dough using an ice cream scoop. Bake for 11 minutes or until the cookies are crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside.
notes_on_texture: Crisp on the outside, chewy on the inside.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer, baking sheet, parchment paper, ice cream scoop
cleaned_texture: Crisp on the outside chewy on the inside

title: The Best Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup organic granulated cane sugar (100g), 1/2 cup organic brown sugar (110g), 1/2 cup vegan butter (112g), 1/4 cup + 2 tbsp coconut milk/aquafaba (90ml), 2 tsp vanilla (10g), 2 1/4 cup all-purpose flour (270g), 1 tsp baking soda (5g), 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup chocolate chunks/chips (120g), fancy sea salt
directions: 1. Whisk sugars, melted coconut oil, aquafaba/coconut milk, and vanilla in a bowl until combined. 2. Sift in flour, baking soda, and salt, and fold into wet ingredients. 3. Fold in chocolate chips until evenly dispersed. 4. Chill dough in fridge for 30 minutes. 5. Scoop dough into balls, bake for 10-13 minutes. 6. Let cookies cool on tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Crinkled edges with golden brown spots, slightly chewy
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, spatula, cookie scoop, baking tray, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Crinkled edges with golden brown spots slightly chewy

title: Crispy Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (168g) superfine blanched almond flour, 1/4 cup (30g) tapioca starch, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp fine sea salt, 1/2 cup (160g) pure maple syrup, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 cup dairy-free chocolate chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F and line a sheet pan with parchment paper. 
                      Whisk almond flour, tapioca starch, baking powder, and sea salt in a large bowl. 
                      Make a well, add maple syrup and vanilla, stir until thick batter forms. 
                      Fold in chocolate chips, then drop batter onto the prepared sheet using a cookie scoop. 
                      Bake for 12-13 minutes until golden.
notes_on_texture: Crispy exterior texture with a chewy center.
equipment_needed: Sheet pan, parchment paper, whisk, cookie scoop
cleaned_texture: Crispy exterior texture with a chewy center

title: Crispy Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (168g) superfine blanched almond flour, 1/4 cup (30g) tapioca starch, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt, 1/2 cup (160g) pure maple syrup, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1/2 cup dairy-free chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Add almond flour, tapioca, baking powder, salt, and ginger (if using) to a bowl and whisk. Make a well in the center and pour in syrup and vanilla. Stir, add chocolate chips, form batter. Scoop cookies, bake for 12-13 minutes until golden. Cool on pan, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy exterior with chewy inside. Let cool to firm up.
equipment_needed: Cookie scooper, parchment paper, dark metal sheet pan
cleaned_texture: Crispy exterior with chewy inside Let cool to firm up

title: Thin Crispy Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups gluten free oat flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/3 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup melted coconut oil, 1/2 cup + 2 tablespoons coconut sugar, 1 flax egg (1 tablespoon ground flaxseed + 3 tablespoons warm water), 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup, 1 1/4 cups vegan chocolate chips, 2-3 tablespoons vegan chocolate chips for topping
directions: Whisk together dry ingredients in one bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together wet ingredients. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop dough onto baking sheet, flatten slightly, and top with extra chocolate chips. Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are crispy. Let cool on the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
notes_on_texture: Thin and crispy with a slight chew.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, baking sheet, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Thin and crispy with a slight chew

title: The Best Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup organic granulated cane sugar, 1/2 cup organic brown sugar, 1/2 cup vegan butter (softened), 1/4 cup + 2 tbsp coconut milk/aquafaba, 2 tsp vanilla, 2 1/4 cups all purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup chocolate chunks/chips, fancy sea salt
directions: Whisk together cane sugar, brown sugar, melted coconut oil, aquafaba/coconut milk, and vanilla. Sift in flour and baking soda. Fold in salt and chocolate chips. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Portion dough into balls, bake for 10-13 minutes. Tap tray for crinkled edges. Cool on tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with chewy inside and crinkled top.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking tray, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with chewy inside and crinkled top

title: Best Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups plain flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup vegan butter (softened), 3/4 cup white sugar, 3/4 cup dark brown sugar, 2 tbsp flax egg (whisked with 5 tbsp water), 1 tsp vanilla, 2 cups vegan chocolate chips, pinch sea salt
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Add water and vanilla, then fold in flax egg. Mix in dry ingredients, then fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes. Let cool on rack.
notes_on_texture: Soft, chewy, with a crispy exterior.
equipment_needed: Baking sheets, greaseproof paper, ice cream or cookie scoop
cleaned_texture: Soft chewy with a crispy exterior

title: Crispy Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1/3 cup melted vegan butter, 1/3 cup cane sugar, 2/3 cup packed brown sugar, 2 tbsp non-dairy milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/3 cup all purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/8 tsp sea salt, 1 tsp cream of tartar, 1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Melt vegan butter and mix with sugars, oat milk, and vanilla. Fold in flour, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt. Combine well. Fold in chocolate chips. Freeze dough balls for 5 minutes, then bake for 11 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy and perfectly round, can use mason jar lid for shape.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, spatula, microwave-safe bowl, baking sheet, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Crispy and perfectly round can use mason jar lid for shape

title: Simple Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 tbsp cornstarch, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp sea salt, 2/3 cup salted vegan butter, 2/3 cup light brown sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/3 cup dairy-free yogurt or applesauce, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 cup vegan chocolate chips, 1 bar vegan chocolate (chopped)
directions: Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Whisk flour, baking soda, and sea salt. In a separate bowl, mix butter, sugars, yogurt, and vanilla. Fold in the dry ingredients, then chocolate chips. Chill dough for 20-30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop and bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden. Let cool for 10 minutes.
notes_on_texture: Soft with golden edges and a chewy center.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Soft with golden edges and a chewy center

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup coconut oil or vegan butter (softened), 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup plant-based milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp sea salt, 1 cup dark chocolate chips, coarse salt for sprinkling
directions: Cream vegan butter with sugar. Add milk and vanilla, beat until fluffy. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix in chocolate chips. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop cold dough onto baking tray and bake for 12-14 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes on sheet before transferring.
notes_on_texture: Soft with a chewy center and crisp edges.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or large bowl, spatula, baking tray, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Soft with a chewy center and crisp edges

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Domestic Gothess)
ingredients: 1/4 cup vegan butter, 1/3 cup + 1 Tbsp light brown sugar, 2 Tbsp caster sugar, 1 Tbsp non-dairy milk, 3/4 cup + 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 Tbsp cornstarch, 3 oz dairy-free dark chocolate (chopped)
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment. Cream vegan butter and sugars. Mix in vanilla and milk. Sift in flour, baking powder, and cornstarch. Stir in chocolate. Divide dough into 8 balls, flatten slightly, and bake for 10-15 minutes. Let cool before transferring to a wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Soft with a slight crisp once cooled.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, electric mixer, baking sheets, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Soft with a slight crisp once cooled

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Loopy Whisk)
ingredients: 1/3 cup + 1/2 tbsp granulated sugar, 1/2 cup + 2 tbsp light brown sugar, 1/3 cup + 2 tbsp vegetable or sunflower oil, 4 tbsp non-dairy milk, 1/2 tsp vanilla paste, 1 3/4 cups + 1 tbsp all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, pinch of salt, 3 1/2 oz dark chocolate chips
directions: Whisk sugars, oil, non-dairy milk, and vanilla. Sift in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix until smooth. Fold in most of the chocolate. Scoop dough and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 355°F. Bake for 10-12 minutes, flattening halfway and adding extra chocolate. Let cool before transferring to a wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with a gooey/fudgy middle.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with a gooeyfudgy middle

title: The Best Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (It Doesn't Taste Like Chicken)
ingredients: 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup vegan butter (melted), 1/4 cup applesauce, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar, 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 8 oz chopped vegan chocolate
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk sugars, melted butter, applesauce, vanilla, and apple cider vinegar. Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix well and stir in chocolate. Scoop 2 tbsp dough balls onto a baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes until edges brown. Let cookies cool on the sheet to flatten.
notes_on_texture: Chewy and soft, becomes chewier as they cool.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheets, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Chewy and soft becomes chewier as they cool

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Chocolate Covered Katie)
ingredients: 1 cup white, oat, or spelt flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar or coconut sugar, 1/3 cup chocolate chips, 2 tbsp milk, 2 tbsp oil or melted vegan butter, 1/4 tsp vanilla extract
directions: Combine dry ingredients in a bowl, then stir in wet ingredients until dough forms. Add extra milk if needed. Chill dough for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 325°F. Form dough balls and bake for 11 minutes. Let cookies cool on tray for 10 minutes to firm up.
notes_on_texture: Soft and chewy, will firm up as they cool.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, baking tray, spatula, whisk
cleaned_texture: Soft and chewy will firm up as they cool

title: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Eat With Clarity)
ingredients: 1/2 cup softened vegan butter, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup applesauce, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 cups gluten-free or regular all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1-1 1/4 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat butter and sugars together. Add wet ingredients and mix well. Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined baking sheet. Bake for 12-16 minutes. Cool on sheet for 15 minutes before transferring to wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Slightly crispy outsides with soft, chewy centers.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, stand mixer, cookie scoop, baking sheet, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Slightly crispy outsides with soft chewy centers

title: The Most Wonderful Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Baker by Nature)
ingredients: 1/2 cup coconut oil, 1 1/4 cups light brown sugar, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 cup coconut milk, 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce, 2 1/3 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 cups chocolate chips, flaky sea salt (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Whisk together coconut oil, brown sugar, and vanilla. Add coconut milk and applesauce, mix well. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Add dry ingredients to wet mixture, fold in 1 3/4 cups chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto sheet, bake for 9-10 minutes. Press remaining chocolate chips on top, sprinkle with sea salt. Cool for 15 minutes before transferring to a rack.
notes_on_texture: Thick, chewy cookies with golden edges.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, spatula, baking sheet, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Thick chewy cookies with golden edges

title: Perfect Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (From My Bowl)
ingredients: 1 tbsp ground flaxseed, 2 1/2 tbsp water, 1/2 cup salted vegan butter, 1/2 cup cane sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsp cornstarch, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp kosher salt, 1-1 1/2 cups dairy-free chocolate chips, flaky salt (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Prepare flax egg. Cream butter and sugars. Add flax egg and vanilla, mix until smooth. Mix in dry ingredients until dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest for 10 minutes on sheet, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Puffy, chewy with golden edges, deflates while cooling.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, stand mixer or electric mixer, baking sheet, spatula, wire rack
cleaned_texture: Puffy chewy with golden edges deflates while cooling

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Butternut Bakery)
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, 1/2 cup dark brown sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1 tsp vanilla bean paste, 1 large egg + 1 egg yolk, 1 cup + 1 tbsp gluten-free all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup oat flour, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 cup bittersweet chocolate, 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, flaky sea salt
directions: Whisk together flours, baking soda, and salt. Cream melted butter and sugars. Mix in vanilla and eggs. Add dry ingredients and fold in chocolates. Chill dough for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 375°F. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Push in sides with a fork for round cookies, sprinkle with sea salt, and cool.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with puffed and doughy centers.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, spatula, baking sheet, wire rack, cookie scoop
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with puffed and doughy centers

title: Chewy Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (My Gluten-Free Kitchen)
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups gluten-free flour, 1/2 tsp xanthan gum, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 2 oz cream cheese, 3/4 cup unsalted butter (melted), 1 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 egg yolks, 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions: Whisk together gluten-free flour, xanthan gum, baking soda, and salt. In a mixer, combine cream cheese, melted butter, and sugars. Add vanilla and egg yolks. Mix in dry ingredients, fold in chocolate chips. Chill dough for 4 hours. Preheat oven to 375°F. Scoop dough onto lined baking sheets and bake for 11-12 minutes. Let cool on sheet for 2-3 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Chewy with undercooked centers that firm up while cooling.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, stand mixer, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheets, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Chewy with undercooked centers that firm up while cooling

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Meaningful Eats)
ingredients: 1 1/3 cups gluten-free flour, 1/4 cup almond flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 cup butter, 1 tbsp milk, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup chocolate chips, sea salt (optional)
directions: Whisk together gluten-free flour, almond flour, baking soda, and salt. Melt butter in a skillet until browned, then whisk in milk, sugars, egg, and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients, fold in chocolate chips. Let dough rest for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop dough onto baking sheets, bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes, sprinkle with sea salt if desired.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with soft, chewy centers.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, spatula, baking sheets, wire rack, skillet
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with soft chewy centers

title: Perfect Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Let Them Eat Gluten-Free Cake)
ingredients: 1 cup butter (softened), 2 cups brown sugar, 4 cups gluten-free flour blend, 1 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, 2 tbsp dark rum (optional), 12 oz chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Cream butter and brown sugar, beat until fluffy. Add eggs, vanilla, and rum, mix. Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt, then slowly add to wet ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto parchment-lined sheets. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool on sheets for 3 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Large, soft cookies with crispy edges.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, stand mixer, spatula, baking sheets, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Large soft cookies with crispy edges

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Mama Gourmand)
ingredients: 8 tbsp unsalted butter (melted), 3/4 cup light brown sugar, 1/3 cup granulated sugar, 1 egg, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 3/4 cups + 2 tbsp gluten-free flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 1/4 cups semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Beat together melted butter, sugars, egg, and vanilla. Add flour, baking soda, and salt, mix until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 325°F. Scoop dough onto baking sheets. Bake for 12-14 minutes. Cool on sheets for 10 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Soft centers with set edges, slightly chewy.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, stand mixer, cookie scoop, baking sheets, parchment paper or silicone mats, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Soft centers with set edges slightly chewy

title: Brown Butter Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 3/4 cup unsalted butter, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 egg + 1 egg yolk, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 3/4 cup gluten-free flour, 3/4 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp sea salt, 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate (chopped)
directions: Brown butter on medium heat, cool. Mix brown butter and brown sugar, then add eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix flour, salt, and baking soda. Combine wet and dry ingredients, fold in chocolate. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Scoop dough onto baking sheets, bake for 11 minutes. Cool before eating.
notes_on_texture: Crispy edges with gooey centers.
equipment_needed: Saucepan, baking sheets, parchment paper, mixing bowl, cookie scoop, rubber spatula
cleaned_texture: Crispy edges with gooey centers

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Gluten-Free on a Shoestring)
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups gluten-free flour blend, 1/2 tsp xanthan gum, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 1 tsp baking soda, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 3/4 cup light brown sugar, 8 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 large eggs, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 12-16 oz semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Whisk together flour, xanthan gum, salt, baking soda, and sugars. Add butter, eggs, and vanilla, mix until well combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Shape dough into 1 1/2-inch balls, flatten into disks, and refrigerate for 12 hours. Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes. Cool on sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Thick and chewy with a slightly crisp edge.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, stand mixer (optional), cookie scoop, baking sheets, parchment paper, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Thick and chewy with a slightly crisp edge

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Mama Knows Gluten-Free)
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp molasses, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 large egg, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp gluten-free baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 1/2 cups gluten-free flour with xanthan gum, 2 cups chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Beat butter, sugars, egg, molasses, and vanilla until creamy. Add gluten-free flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt, mix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto parchment-lined sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool and store in an air-tight container.
notes_on_texture: Soft centers with slightly crisp edges.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, stand mixer, cookie scoop, baking sheets, parchment paper, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Soft centers with slightly crisp edges

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (JoyFoodSunshine)
ingredients: 1/2 cup salted butter, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup light brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 large egg, 1 1/2 cups gluten-free flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp sea salt, 1 cup chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Mix gluten-free flour, baking soda, baking powder, and sea salt. Cream butter and sugars, add egg and vanilla, mix well. Add dry ingredients, stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto baking sheets. Bake for 9-10 minutes. Cool on sheet for 5-10 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Barely set with soft centers.
equipment_needed: Measuring spoons, measuring cups, spatula, mixer, baking sheet, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Barely set with soft centers

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Flippin' Delicious)
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter (melted), 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 egg yolks, 1/2 tsp xanthan gum, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp vanilla, 1 1/2 cups gluten-free flour mix, 1 cup chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugar, add egg yolks, mix well. Add xanthan gum, salt, baking soda, and vanilla, mix. Add flour and stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto prepared sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Let cool on sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.
notes_on_texture: Soft with a chewy center, slightly crispy edges.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, cooling rack, parchment paper or silicone mat
cleaned_texture: Soft with a chewy center slightly crispy edges

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Bojon Gourmet)
ingredients: 8 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/2 vanilla bean (or 1/2 tsp vanilla extract), 1/2 cup dark brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 1/2 cup sweet white rice flour, 1/2 cup gluten-free oat flour, 2 tbsp tapioca flour, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp sea salt, 7 oz bittersweet chocolate, 1/2 cup toasted pecans (optional), flaky salt (optional)
directions: Brown butter in a saucepan. Mix browned butter with sugars, let cool. Add egg and vanilla. Sift flours, baking soda, and salt, stir into sugar mixture. Stir in chocolate and pecans. Let dough rest for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375°F. Scoop dough onto sheets, bake for 7-10 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before eating.
notes_on_texture: Chewy with soft centers and crispy edges, slightly underbaked for texture.
equipment_needed: Saucepan, cookie scoop, baking sheets, kitchen scale, parchment paper, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Chewy with soft centers and crispy edges slightly underbaked for texture

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Iowa Girl Eats)
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter (softened), 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/4 cups gluten-free flour with binder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp rounded salt, 1 cup gluten-free chocolate chips
directions: Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla, mix well. In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, stir in chocolate chips. Chill dough for 24-48 hours. Preheat oven to 375°F, scoop dough onto lined sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes on pan before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Golden edges with soft, pale centers. More fragile than regular cookies when hot.
equipment_needed: Half sheet pan, mixing bowl, electric mixer, cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Golden edges with soft pale centers More fragile than regular cookies when hot

title: Crispy Chocolate Chip Cookies (Sweets and Thank You)
ingredients: 1 cup butter (softened), 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup light brown sugar, 1 large egg, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 2 cups gluten-free flour, 1 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp kosher salt, 1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugars, then add egg and vanilla. Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough, roll into balls, and bake for 11-13 minutes for crispy cookies. Let cool on sheet for 2-3 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Thin and crispy, with optional extra chocolate chips for a decorative touch.
equipment_needed: Stand mixer or hand mixer, baking sheets, cookie scoop, wire cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Thin and crispy with optional extra chocolate chips for a decorative touch

title: Crispy Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Gluten-Free Baking)
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups white rice flour, 1/2 cup sweet rice flour, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 1/2 sticks melted butter, 1 cup dark brown sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg, 1 egg yolk, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 (12 oz) bag chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Whisk together flours, cornstarch, baking soda, and salt. In a large bowl, combine melted butter, sugars, egg, egg yolk, and vanilla. Stir in flour mixture, then fold in chocolate chips. Drop dough onto sheet, bake for 15-18 minutes until golden. Cool on wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy with a slight chew, perfect for storage.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, wooden spoon, baking sheet, parchment paper, cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Crispy with a slight chew perfect for storage

title: Crispy Chocolate Chip Cookies (Feasting on Fruit)
ingredients: 1 cup almond butter, 1/2 cup coconut sugar, 1/4 cup tapioca starch (or 2 flax eggs), 1/4 cup non-dairy milk, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp sea salt, 1/3 cup mini chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk together almond butter, coconut sugar, non-dairy milk, and vanilla. Add tapioca starch, baking soda, and salt, stir to combine. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined sheet, bake for 12-14 minutes. Cool for 5-10 minutes before transferring to rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy and thin, spreads quite a bit.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Crispy and thin spreads quite a bit

title: Dairy-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (The Whole Cook)
ingredients: 1/4 cup refined coconut oil, 1/2 cup vegan butter, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla, 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 12 oz dairy-free semi-sweet morsels
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Beat vegan butter and coconut oil. Add sugars and baking soda, beat until combined. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Slowly beat in flour, then stir in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined baking sheet. Bake for 7.5-8 minutes. Optional: Add more chocolate chips to tops after baking. Cool on wire rack.
notes_on_texture: Soft, with optional extra chocolate on top for decoration.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, hand mixer, baking sheet, parchment paper, wire cooling rack
cleaned_texture: Soft with optional extra chocolate on top for decoration

title: Dairy-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Frosting and Fettuccine)
ingredients: 1/2 cup dairy-free butter, 2/3 cup brown sugar, 2 tbsp white sugar, 2 egg yolks, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1/4 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp kosher salt, 1 1/2 cups dairy-free semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Melt dairy-free butter and mix with sugars. Add egg yolks and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined sheets, bake for 12-14 minutes. Cool on sheet for 3 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Crispy on the outside with chewy centers. Optionally shape into perfect rounds after baking.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Crispy on the outside with chewy centers Optionally shape into perfect rounds after baking

title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies (Cake by Katie)
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups gluten-free 1:1 baking blend, 1/2 tbsp coarse sea salt, 2 tsp cornstarch, 1 tsp baking soda, 3/4 cup dairy-free salted butter (softened), 1 cup brown sugar, 1/3 cup granulated sugar, 1 large egg + 1 egg yolk, 1 tbsp vanilla extract, 1 1/2 cups dairy-free semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions: Combine gluten-free flour, sea salt, cornstarch, and baking soda. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars, then add egg, yolk, and vanilla. Mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients, then fold in chocolate chips. Chill dough for 2-3 hours or overnight. Scoop dough onto lined sheets, bake for 12-13 minutes. Cool on sheet for 10 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Slightly underbaked centers with crispy edges, benefits from overnight chilling.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, cookie scoop, baking sheet, cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Slightly underbaked centers with crispy edges benefits from overnight chilling

title: Thin Crispy Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies (Beaming Baker)
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups gluten-free oat flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/3 tsp salt, 1/2 cup melted coconut oil, 1/2 cup + 2 tbsp coconut sugar, 1 flax egg, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 tbsp maple syrup, 1 1/4 cups vegan chocolate chips
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk dry ingredients, set aside. Whisk wet ingredients, then combine with dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Scoop dough onto lined sheets, leave space for spreading. Bake for 12-16 minutes. Cool on sheet for 10 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes_on_texture: Thin, crispy, spreads a lot during baking.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowl, whisk, rubber spatula, baking sheet, cooling rack, parchment paper
cleaned_texture: Thin crispy spreads a lot during baking

title: Vegan Chocolate Vegan Chocolate Cupcake
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups (156g) all-purpose flour, 1 cup (200g) sugar, 1/3 cup (28g) cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1 cup (240ml) almond milk, 1/3 cup (80ml) vegetable oil, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin pan with paper liners. 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 3. In another bowl, mix the almond milk, oil, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla extract. 4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined. 5. Divide the batter evenly among the Vegan Chocolate Cupcake liners, filling each about 2/3 full. 6. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. 7. Let cool completely before frosting.
notes_on_texture: Light, moist, and rich in flavor.
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, muffin pan, paper liners
cleaned_texture: Light moist and rich in flavor

directions: 1. Preheat oven and line cupcake tin with liners. 2. Whisk dry ingredients together. 3. Mix wet ingredients separately. 4. Combine wet and dry mixtures until smooth. 5. directions: 1. Preheat oven and line cupcake tin with liners. 2. Sift dry ingredients together. 3. Add wet ingredients and mix until smooth. 4. Pour batter into liners, filling _ full. 5. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 6. Prepare frosting: beat vegan butter until creamy; add powdered sugar, cocoa powder, plant-based milk, and vanilla extract; mix until smooth. 7. Frost cooled cupcakes.
notes_on_texture: Soft and moist
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, cupcake tin, oven
cleaned_texture: Soft and moist

title: Vegan Chocolate Cupcakes
ingredients: All-purpose flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt, soy or almond milk, apple cider vinegar, canola oil, vanilla extract, dark chocolate; Ganache: dark chocolate, soy or almond milk, granulated sugar; Whipped Frosting: vegan whipping cream, confectioner's sugar, chocolate shavings
directions: 1. Preheat oven and line cupcake tin with liners. 2. Mix dry ingredients. 3. Combine soy or almond milk with apple cider vinegar; let sit to curdle. 4. Add wet ingredients to dry and mix until smooth. 5. Stir in melted dark chocolate. 6. Pour batter into liners, filling _ full. 7. Bake for 17 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. 8. Prepare ganache: heat dark chocolate, soy or almond milk, and granulated sugar until smooth. 9. Hollow out center of each cupcake and fill with ganache. 10. Prepare whipped frosting: whip vegan whipping cream and confectioner's sugar until it holds shape. 11. Frost cupcakes and top with chocolate shavings.
notes_on_texture: Light and fluffy
equipment_needed: Mixing bowls, whisk, saucepan, cupcake tin, oven
cleaned_texture: Light and fluffy
